Tool Information: - Name: HTSeq.Count - Version: Modified to use datasets.genepattern.org instead of ftp\://gpftp.broadinstitutue.org as source for default gtf files - Language: Python - Description: Takes alignment files in SAM/BAM format and a feature file in GTF/GFF format (usually with exon annotation), name sorts the alignment file and calculates for each sample the number of reads mapping to each feature. (HTSeq.count v0.11.2) - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/HTSeq.Count/releases/tag/v3.0 Planning Data: {'module_name': 'HTSeq.Count', 'parameters': [{'name': 'input.files', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Input file(s) in SAM or BAM format.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'bam;sam', 'num_values': '1+'}, {'name': 'sample.names', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Text file with the names of the samples, one per line (optional and only relevant if you request Excel or GCT format). The names in the file must be in the same order as the input SAM/BAM files. If you do not provide a file the sample names will be derived from the SAM/BAM file names.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'txt', 'prefix': '--names', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'GTF.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A GTF or GFF file containing a list of gene model annotations. (This file can be gzipped)', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'gff;gff3;gtf;gtf.gz;gff.gz;gff3.gz', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'strandedness', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': "none \\: a read is considered overlapping with a feature regardless of whether it is mapped to the same or the opposite strand as the feature.\\n

\\nforward \\: a single-end read has to be mapped to the same strand as the feature, for paired-end reads the first read has to be on the same strand and the second read on the opposite strand.\\n

\\nreverse \\: the above rules are reversed.\\n

\\nset to 'none' if your input file contains no strand information.", 'required': True, 'default_value': 'yes', 'choices': 'no\\=none;yes\\=forward;reverse\\=reverse', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'min.qual', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Minimum quality to accept a read.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '10', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'mode', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Mode to handle reads overlapping more than one feature. Consult the documentation for a full explanation.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'union', 'choices': 'union\\=union;intersection-strict\\=intersection-strict;intersection-nonempty\\=intersection-nonempty', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'count.nonunique', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Whether to count reads that are not uniquely aligned or are ambiguously assigned to features.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'none', 'choices': 'all\\=yes;none\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'count.secondary', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Whether to count secondary alignments (which are marked in the SAM/BAM file by a 0x100 flag).', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'ignore', 'choices': 'score\\=yes;ignore\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'count.supplementary', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Whether to count supplementary alignments (which are marked in the SAM/BAM file by a 0x800 flag).', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'ignore', 'choices': 'score\\=yes;ignore\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'feature.type', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Name in the 3rd column of the GTF/GFF input file that is used to identify the features that must be counted.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'exon', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'id.type', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'GTF/GFF attribute used to group features.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'gene_id', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'gene.name', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'GTF/GFF attribute with the name of the gene or some other information that can help to identify the gene in a more user-friendly way than the ID (optional). If you fill this in an extra column will be added to the output table. For Ensembl data gene_id is suitable.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '--genename', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'output.file', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'output file name - Inputfile_Basename.Output_Filename (if you choose GCT format .gct will automatically be added)', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'HTSeq.counts', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'output.format', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': '', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'htseq', 'choices': 'htseq\\=raw HTSeq format;excel\\=with header added, suitable for import in Excel;gct\\=GCT', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/htseq_count\\:0.6', 'categories': 'RNA-seq', 'task_type': 'RNA-seq', 'author': 'Barbara Hill;Broad Institute, Guy Bottu;VIB BioinformaticsCore', 'command_line': '/htseq_count/htseqcount_input_detect_and_sort.py --htseqcount htseq-count --input --gtf --strand --minqual --mode --nonunique --secondary --supplementary --featuretype --idtype --output --outformat '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for OutSplice.

Tool Information:
- Name: OutSplice
- Version: Remove genome, txdb and annotation parameters, leaving only the presets
- Language: any
- Description: OutSplice is a package that compares alternative splicing events between tumor and normal samples. This package is specifically designed for analyzing the gene and junction information from RNA sequencing data provided by the user, or from the TCGA. This package generates a matrix of splicing outliers, which are junctions that are either significantly over or under-expressed compared to a control sample. OutSplice further designates observed outliers as skipping, insertion, or deletion events. Overall, OutSplice is novel in that it determines differential splicing burdens between tumors and normal samples and characterizes the nature of splicing outliers.
- Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/OutSplice

Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for scVelo. Tool Information: - Name: scVelo - Version: Initial release - Language: any - Description: Module for performing basic velocity analysis using the scVelo protocol on ScanpyUtilities processed datasets - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/scVelo/tree/v1 Planning Data: {'module_name': 'scVelo', 'parameters': [{'name': 'h5ad', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Dimensionally reduced h5ad from ScanpyUtilities', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'h5ad', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Marker.Genes', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A list of marker genes to plot on the embedded graph', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'txt', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Velocity.Mode', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': "Mode for performing the velocity estimation. Supports 'deterministic', 'stochastic' (default), or 'dynamical' methods for computing splicing kinetics.", 'required': True, 'default_value': 'stochastic', 'choices': 'deterministic\\=deterministic;stochastic\\=stochastic;dynamical\\=dynamical', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'min_shared_counts', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Filter genes by minimum shared counts across cells', 'required': True, 'default_value': '30', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'n_top_genes', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Top N variable genes to use for velocity calculation', 'required': True, 'default_value': '2000', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'recalculate_highly_variable_genes', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': "If highly_variable_genes have already been calculated externally, force their re-computation with Scanpy using the selected method.
If set to 'false' and the highly_variable_genes key isn't found in the data, the calculation will be automatically performed using the Seruat_v3 method.

Selecting options other than 'false' will force re-calculation of PCA, the KNN graph, and UMAP embeddings.", 'required': True, 'default_value': 'False', 'choices': 'False\\=false;seurat_v3\\=seurat_v3;cell_ranger\\=cell_ranger', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Enforce.Normalization', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Typically, the top level counts matrix used by most tools such as scanpy and seurat will already be normalized.
scVelo requires that the separate spliced and unspliced counts layers used only by velocity calculations also be normalized.
Setting Enforce.Normalization to "all" will cause scVelo to force normalization of all three layers of the data.
Setting Enforce.Normalization to "velocity" (default) will only normalize the velocity specific spliced and unspliced layers.
Setting Enforce.Normalization to "none" will use the dataset as is for all layers.
Note\\: selecting "all" will force re-calculation of PCA, the KNN graph, and UMAP embeddings.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'velocity', 'choices': 'all\\=all;velocity\\=velocity;none\\=none', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'N_PCs', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Number of principal components used in calculation of the gene moments of spliced/unspliced abundances.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '30', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'N_Neighbors', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Number of nearest neighbors used in calculation of the gene moments of spliced/unspliced abundances.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '30', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Differential.Kinetics.Analysis', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Perform differential kinetics analysis on the basis of dataset clustering using dynamical velocity estimations.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'False', 'choices': 'False\\=false;True\\=true', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Embedding', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Select the type of embedding used in ScanpyUtilities.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'umap', 'choices': 'umap\\=umap;tsne\\=tsne', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Clustering', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Autodetect existing clusters in the dataset, or run clustering using choice of leiden or louvian algorithms. If no clustering is detected with "autodetect_existing", "leiden" will be used.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'autodetect_existing', 'choices': 'autodetect_existing\\=autodetect_existing;run_leiden\\=run_leiden;run_louvain\\=run_louvain', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Cluster.Resolution', 'type': 'Floating Point', 'description': 'Resolution to use if running leiden or louvain clustering on the dataset.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '1.0', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Regression.Keys', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Any keys to regress out of the dataset (i.e. batch) using scanpy.pp.regress_out().
Should be specified as a non-quoted comma separated list.

Regressing out a key will force re-calculation of PCA, the KNN graph, and UMAP embeddings.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'NONE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Plot.Batches', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Produce individual velocity plots for each batch in the dataset (if present).', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'True', 'choices': 'True\\=true;False\\=false', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Save.Plot.Type', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Save velocity plots as png or svg (or pdf; not recommended due to pdf element count limitations).', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'png', 'choices': 'png\\=png;svg\\=svg;pdf\\=pdf', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'output.file.base', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Output basename for velocity calculation results.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/scvelo\\:v1', 'categories': 'single-cell;singlecell;rna velocity', 'task_type': 'single-cell', 'author': 'GenePattern Team', 'command_line': 'python /build/compute_scvelo.py -i -m -v -s -t -g -f -c -n -d -e -l -r -k -b -p -o -j '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

{'module_name': 'FastQC', 'parameters': [{'name': 'input.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'RNA-seq reads file in FASTQ (bz2 and gz compressed files are supported), SAM, or BAM format.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'fastq;fastq.gz;fq;fq.gz;txt;sam;bam'}, {'name': 'input.format', 'type': 'java.lang.String', 'description': 'Bypasses the normal sequence file format detection and forces the program to use the specified format.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'choices': '\\=;fastq\\=FASTQ;bam\\=BAM;sam\\=SAM'}, {'name': 'contaminant.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'FastQC screens overrepresented sequences (> 0.1% of total) against a set of possible contaminants consisting of all the primers and adapters used by the various sequencing platforms.  The "Overrepresented sequences" report generated by FastQC will indicate when an overrepresented sequence corresponds to a known contaminant.  This optional contaminant file provides a means of adding more sequences to FastQC\'s built-in list of known contaminants. See module documentation for a description and example of this file\'s format.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'txt'}, {'name': 'kmer.size', 'type': 'java.lang.String', 'description': 'The length of Kmer to look for in the Kmer content module. instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for ComBat_Seq.

Tool Information:
- Name: ComBat_Seq
- Version: Added batch correction tag
- Language: any
- Description: ComBat_Seq module. A Batch effect adjustment tool for bulk RNA-seq count data. Improvement upon ComBat,  and uses a negative binomial regression to model batch effects. ComBat-seq takes untransformed, raw count matrix as input. Provides adjusted data which preserves the integer nature of counts, so that the adjusted data are compatible with the assumptions of state-of-the-art differential expression software (e.g. edgeR, DESeq2, which request untransformed count data)\nOriginal Documentation\: https\://github.com/zhangyuqing/ComBat-seq \nCredits go to Zhang et al, https\://doi.org/10.1093/nargab/lqaa078
- Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/ComBat-Seq

instruction: Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for spatialGE.Preprocessing. Tool Information: - Name: spatialGE.Preprocessing - Version: Strip .tar from output filenames if its part of the input filename. Stop putting .rds on the rds file twice. - Language: R - Description: The package spatialGE provides a collection of tools for the visualization of gene expression from spatially-resolved transcriptomic experiments. The data input methods have been designed so that any data can be analyzed as long as it contains gene expression counts per region of interest (ROI), spot, or cell, and the spatial coordinates of those ROIs, spots, or cells, as it is generated in platforms such as GeoMx, Visium, and CosMx-SMI. The spatialge.Preprocessing module performs initial data ingestion, filtering, transform and pseudo-bulk operations to prepare data for further processing. Order of operations are\: ingestion, filter, pseudobulk, transform. - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/spatialGE.Preprocessing Planning Data: {'module_name': 'spatialGE.Preprocessing', 'parameters': [{'name': 'input.data.archive', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Input data archive in gz format. instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for Salmon.Indexer. Tool Information: - Name: Salmon.Indexer - Version: Updated to Salmon 1.6.0 and added support for transcriptome only index - Language: any - Description: Salmon (version 1.6.0) transcriptome indexer.
\n\nSee\: The Salmon User Guide\nfor detailed usage guidelines. - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/Salmon.Indexer/tree/v0.5 Planning Data: {'module_name': 'Salmon.Indexer', 'parameters': [{'name': 'GTF.gz', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': "GTF file (must be gzipped).\\nOnly used if a transcriptome fasta is not provided to the 'Transcriptome fa gz' parameter, or producing a decoy-aware index. Both require that a genome fasta is provided to the 'Genome fa gz' parameter.", 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.gtf.gz;gtf.gz', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Transcriptome.fa.gz', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Transcriptome FASTA file (must be gzipped)
\\nIf no Transcriptome FASTA is provided the module will attempt to generate one from the GTF and Genomic FASTA using gffread. This procedure has not been fully tested.\\n', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.fa.gz;.fastq.gz;.fq.gz;fa.gz;fastq.gz;fq.gz', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Genome.fa.gz', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Genomic FASTA file (must be gzipped). Used when producing a decoy-aware index, or when reconstructing a transcriptome from a provided gtf.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.fa.gz;.fastq.gz;.fq.gz;fa.gz;fastq.gz;fq.gz', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'kmer', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'kmer size used for indexing (must be odd)', 'required': False, 'default_value': '31', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Index.Mode', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': "There are two options for generating a decoy-aware transcriptome\\:\\n
\\nFull\\: Uses the entire genome of the organism as the decoy sequence. This scheme provides a more comprehensive set of decoys resulting in more accurate quantification, but, produces a substantially larger index, requires considerably more memory to build and quantify against the index, and quantifications against the index are slower.\\n
\\nPartial\\: Computes a set of decoy sequences by mapping the annotated transcripts you wish to index against a hard-masked version of the organism's genome. This produces a smaller index and requires substantially less memory quantify against, but may be more susceptible to spurious mappings.\\n
\\nIf no Genome fasta is provided, this parameter will be ignored.", 'required': True, 'default_value': 'full', 'choices': 'full\\=Full;partial\\=Partial', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Use.Gencode', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Use Gencode format parsing for Transcriptome fasta record IDs', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=true;FALSE\\=false', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/salmon-indexer\\:beta_1.6.0', 'categories': 'preprocess & utilities;rna-seq', 'task_type': 'rna-seq', 'author': 'Anthony S. Castanza;UCSD-MesirovLab', 'command_line': 'salmon_index.sh -a -t -g -k -m -f -l -j '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

Castanza;UCSD-MesirovLab categories=preprocess & utilities;rna-seq commandLine=salmon_index.sh -a -t -g -k -m -f -l -j cpuType=any description=Salmon (version 1.6.0) transcriptome indexer.

Both require that a genome fasta is provided to the 'Genome fa gz' parameter. p1_fileFormat=.gtf.gz;gtf.gz p1_flag=-a p1_name=GTF.gz p1_numValues=0..1 p1_optional=on p1_prefix= p1_prefix_when_specified= p1_type=java.io.File p1_value= p2_MODE=IN p2_TYPE=FILE p2_default_value= p2_description=Transcriptome FASTA file (must be gzipped)

This procedure has not been fully tested.\n p2_fileFormat=.fa.gz;.fastq.gz;.fq.gz;fa.gz;fastq.gz;fq.gz p2_flag=-t p2_name=Transcriptome.fa.gz p2_numValues=0..1 p2_optional=on p2_prefix= p2_prefix_when_specified= p2_type=java.io.File p2_value= p3_MODE=IN p3_TYPE=FILE p3_default_value= p3_description=Genomic FASTA file (must be gzipped). Used when producing a decoy-aware index, or when reconstructing a transcriptome from a provided gtf. p3_fileFormat=.fa.gz;.fastq.gz;.fq.gz;fa.gz;fastq.gz;fq.gz p3_flag=-g p3_name=Genome.fa.gz p3_numValues=0..1 p3_optional=on p3_prefix= p3_prefix_when_specified= p3_type=java.io.File p3_value= p4_MODE= p4_TYPE=Integer p4_default_value=31 p4_description=kmer size used for indexing (must be odd) p4_fileFormat= p4_flag=-k p4_name=kmer p4_numValues=1..1 p4_optional=on p4_prefix= p4_prefix_when_specified= p4_type=java.lang.Integer p4_value= p5_MODE= p5_TYPE=TEXT p5_default_value=full p5_description=There are two options for generating a decoy-aware transcriptome\:\n

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for GEOImporter.

Tool Information:
- Name: GEOImporter
- Version: Updated NCIBI FTP paths. Added ability to omit rows with all NA values. Updated to use R 4.0.3 via module specific Docker container.
- Language: any
- Description: Imports data from the Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO)
- Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/GEOImporter/releases/tag/v6

Planning Data:
{'module_name': 'GEOImporter', 'parameters': [{'name': 'GEO.accession', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'GEO Series record (GSExxx) or a GEO Dataset (GDSxxx). Either a GEO accession or a GEO SOFT file must be given.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'GEO.SOFT.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A previously downloaded GEO SOFT file or its gzipped representation. Either a GEO SOFT file or a GEO accession must be given.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'gz;soft', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Drop.NA.Rows', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Omit rows containing all "NA" values from GSExxx data series.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'FALSE', 'choices': 'FALSE\\=false;TRUE\\=true', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'data.column.name', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The name of the column that contains the expression values', 'required': False, 'default_value': 'VALUE', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'output.filename', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The name of the output file', 'required': True, 'default_value': '<GEO.accession><GEO.SOFT.file_basename>', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'ftp.proxy.server', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'FTP Proxy server', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'ftp.proxy.username', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'FTP Proxy username', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'ftp.proxy.password', 'type': 'PASSWORD', 'description': 'FTP Proxy password', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'http.proxy.server', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'HTTP Proxy server', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'http.proxy.username', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'HTTP Proxy username', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'http.proxy.password', 'type': 'PASSWORD', 'description': 'HTTP Proxy password', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/geoimporter\\:1', 'categories': 'preprocess & utilities;preprocess & utilities', 'task_type': 'preprocess & utilities', 'author': 'Joshua Gould, Broad Institute; Anthony Castanza, UCSD', 'command_line': 'Rscript --no-save --quiet --slave --no-restore /GEOImporter/main.R /GEOImporter/ -n<Drop.NA.Rows> -d<data.column.name> -o<output.filename> -a<GEO.accession> -f<GEO.SOFT.file> -1<ftp.proxy.server> -2<ftp.proxy.username> -3<ftp.proxy.password> -4<http.proxy.server> -5<http.proxy.username> -6<http.proxy.password>'}

Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for CellFie. Tool Information: - Name: CellFie - Version: update to reaction models - Language: any - Description: CellFie\: Cellular Functions InferencE - An alternative approach to capture the breadth of cellular functions by performing a functional analysis of existing biological networks. Please refer to the documentation for details about the procedure. - Repository: https\://github.com/LewisLabUCSD/CellFie Planning Data: {'module_name': 'CellFie', 'parameters': [{'name': 'Data', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The gene expression matrix can be provided in a .mat or .csv format.\\n

\\nFor .mat files, you need to provide a structure variable (named e.g. "data")\\ncontaining a cell field named "genes" with NCBI Entrez gene IDs (one gene per cell)\\nand a double field named "value" containing a matrix with gene expression values\\nfor each of the samples you want to evaluate (i.e. with rows corresponding to genes\\nand columns corresponding to samples). See available example\\n\\n dataTest.mat.\\n

\\nFor .csv files, you need to provide an expression matrix with rows corresponding\\nto genes and columns corresponding to samples. The first column is the list of genes\\nwith NCBI Entrez gene IDs and the first header row should start with "genes" and\\nbe followed by the name of each sample present in your dataset. See the available\\n\\n dataTest.csv\\nThe list of genes and associated NCBI Entrez IDs present in each reference model\\ncan be downloaded\\n\\n here.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'csv', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Sample.Number', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': '\\ The number of samples in the input file to analyze', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Reference.Model', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': '\\ Name of the reference model to use to compute metabolic task scores', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'MT_recon_2_2_entrez.mat', 'choices': 'MT_recon_2_2_entrez.mat\\=Human_recon_2_2;MT_iCHOv1_final.mat\\=CHO_iCHOv1;MT_iHsa.mat\\=Human_iHsa;MT_iMM1415.mat\\=Mouse_iMM1415;MT_iRno.mat\\=Rat_iRn', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Thresholding.Approach', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Two types of thresholding approaches can be used; either GLOBAL (the threshold is the same for all the genes) or LOCAL (the threshold is gene specific)', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'local', 'choices': 'local\\=local;global\\=global', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Percentile.Or.Value', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The threshold can be defined using a value introduced by the user (VALUE) or based on a percentile of the expression value distribution (PERCENTILE)', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'percentile', 'choices': 'value\\=value;percentile\\=percentile', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Global.Cutoff', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'If you selected the GLOBAL thresholding approach, cutoff value or percentile defining the gene activity threshold', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Local.Threshold.Type', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'If you selected the LOCAL thresholding approach, you can also define the type of local approach; See the available\n\n dataTest.csv\nThe list of genes and associated NCBI Entrez IDs present in each reference model\ncan be downloaded\n\n here. p1_fileFormat=csv p1_flag= p1_name=Data p1_numValues=0..1 p1_optional= p1_prefix= p1_prefix_when_specified= p1_type=java.io.File p1_value= p2_MODE= p2_TYPE=Integer p2_default_value= p2_description=\ The number of samples in the input file to analyze p2_fileFormat= p2_flag= p2_name=Sample.Number p2_numValues=0..1 p2_optional= p2_prefix= p2_prefix_when_specified= p2_type=java.lang.Integer p2_value= p3_MODE= p3_TYPE=TEXT p3_default_value=MT_recon_2_2_entrez.mat p3_description=\ Name of the reference model to use to compute metabolic task scores p3_fileFormat= p3_flag= p3_name=Reference.Model p3_numValues=0..1 p3_optional= p3_prefix= p3_prefix_when_specified= p3_type=java.lang.String p3_value=MT_recon_2_2_entrez.mat\=Human_recon_2_2;MT_iCHOv1_final.mat\=CHO_iCHOv1;MT_iHsa.mat\=Human_iHsa;MT_iMM1415.mat\=Mouse_iMM1415;MT_iRno.mat\=Rat_iRn p4_MODE= p4_TYPE=TEXT p4_default_value=local p4_description=Two types of thresholding approaches can be used; either GLOBAL (the threshold is the same for all the genes) or LOCAL (the threshold is gene specific) p4_fileFormat= p4_flag= p4_name=Thresholding.Approach p4_numValues=0..1 p4_optional= p4_prefix= p4_prefix_when_specified= p4_type=java.lang.String p4_value=local\=local;global\=global p5_MODE= p5_TYPE=TEXT p5_default_value=percentile p5_description=The threshold can be defined using a value introduced by the user (VALUE) or based on a percentile of the expression value distribution (PERCENTILE) p5_fileFormat= p5_flag= p5_name=Percentile.Or.Value p5_numValues=0..1 p5_optional= p5_prefix= p5_prefix_when_specified= p5_type=java.lang.String p5_value=value\=value;percentile\=percentile p6_MODE= p6_TYPE=Integer p6_default_value=0 p6_description=If you selected the GLOBAL thresholding approach, cutoff value or percentile defining the gene activity threshold p6_fileFormat= p6_flag= p6_name=Global.Cutoff p6_numValues=0..1 p6_optional= p6_prefix= p6_prefix_when_specified= p6_type=java.lang.Integer p6_value= p7_MODE= p7_TYPE=TEXT p7_default_value=minmaxmean p7_description=If you selected the LOCAL thresholding approach, you can also define the type of local approach; either MEAN (i.e., the threshold for a gene is defined as the mean expression value of this gene across all the samples, tissues, or conditions) or MINMAXMEAN (i.e., the threshold for a gene is determined by the mean of expression values observed for that gene among all the samples, tissues, or conditions BUT the threshold \:(i) must be higher or equal to a lower bound and (ii) must be lower or equal to an upper bound) p7_fileFormat= p7_flag= p7_name=Local.Threshold.Type p7_numValues=0..1 p7_optional= p7_prefix= p7_prefix_when_specified= p7_type=java.lang.String p7_value=mean\=mean;minmaxmean\=minmaxmean p8_MODE= p8_TYPE=Integer p8_default_value=25 p8_description=If you selected the type MINMAXMEAN for the LOCAL thresholding approach, lower bound to define which gene are always inactive (either a value or a percentile) p8_fileFormat= p8_flag= p8_name=Local.Lower.Bound p8_numValues=0..1 p8_optional= p8_prefix= p8_prefix_when_specified= p8_type=java.lang.Integer p8_value= p9_MODE= p9_TYPE=TEXT p9_default_value=75 p9_description=If you selected the type MINMAXMEAN for the LOCAL thresholding approach, upper bound to define which gene are always inactive (either a value or a percentile) p9_fileFormat= p9_flag= p9_name=Local.Upper.Bound p9_numValues=0..1 p9_optional= p9_prefix= p9_prefix_when_specified= p9_type=java.lang.String p9_value= privacy=public publicationDate=06/29/2021 18\:29 quality=production src.repo=https\://github.com/LewisLabUCSD/CellFie taskDoc=doc.html taskType=metabolomics userid=atwenzel2 version=update to reaction models

The larger x, the closer the factorization to the un-factorized likelihood, but the larger the resulting number of equivalence classes. A value of 1 corresponds to salmon's traditional rich equivalence classes. We recommend 4 (default) as a reasonable parameter for this option (it is what was used in the range-factorization paper).\\n
\\nIgnored if Range.Factorization \\= FALSE", 'required': True, 'default_value': '4', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'biasSpeedSamp', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'When evaluating the bias models (the GC-fragment model specifically), Salmon must consider the probability of generating a fragment of every possible length (with a non-trivial probability) from every position on every transcript. This results in a process that is quadratic in the length of the transcriptome. Setting biasSpeedSamp allows Salmon to consider only every ith fragment length and interploate the intermediate results speeding up this process by a multiplicative factor.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'false', 'choices': 'true\\=TRUE;false\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'biasSpeedSamp.Factor', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Set the sampling factor for biasSpeedSamp. Larger values speed up effective length correction, but may decrease the fidelity of bias modeling. However, reasonably small values (e.g. 10 or less) should have only a minor effect on the computed effective lengths, and can considerably speed up effective length correction on large transcriptomes. The default value for --biasSpeedSamp is 5.
\\nIgnored if biasSpeedSamp \\= FALSE', 'required': True, 'default_value': '5', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/salmon-quant\\:beta_1.6.0', 'categories': 'rna-seq', 'task_type': 'rna-seq', 'author': 'Anthony S. \n
\nSingle-end reads must not have a _R1/_1 or _R2/_2 suffix before the .fq.gz/.fastq.gz file extension.

\nWarning\: Splitting reads for a single sample across multiple files (eg\: SampleA_R1_001.fq.gz, SampleA_R1_002.fq.gz; SampleA_R2_001.fq.gz, SampleA_R2_002.fq.gz;) is not supported. p1_fileFormat=.fastq.gz;.fq.gz;fastq.gz;fq.gz p1_flag=-r p1_name=Reads p1_numValues=1+ p1_optional= p1_prefix= p1_prefix_when_specified= p1_type=java.io.File p1_value= p2_MODE=IN p2_TYPE=FILE p2_choices=https\://datasets.genepattern.org/data/module_support_files/Salmon.Quant/gencode.v39.annotation.k31.salmon_full_decoy_index.tar.gz\=Human_Gencode_v39_Kmer31_Full_Decoy;https\://datasets-genepattern-org.s3.amazonaws.com/data/test_data/Salmon/gencode.v37.annotation.k31.salmon_full_decoy_index.tar.gz\=Human_Gencode_v37_Kmer31_Full_Decoy_Index;https\://datasets.genepattern.org/data/module_support_files/Salmon.Quant/gencode.vM28.annotation.k31.salmon_full_decoy_index.tar.gz\=Mouse_Gencode_vM28_Kmer31_Full_Decoy;https\://datasets-genepattern-org.s3.amazonaws.com/data/test_data/Salmon/gencode.vM26.annotation.k31.salmon_full_decoy_index.tar.gz\=Mouse_Gencode_vM26_Kmer31_Full_Decoy_Index p2_default_value=https\://datasets.genepattern.org/data/module_support_files/Salmon.Quant/gencode.v39.annotation.k31.salmon_full_decoy_index.tar.gz p2_description=An Indexed transcriptome created with `Salmon Indexer`.
\nMust be in .tar.gz format. p2_fileFormat=.tar.gz;tar.gz p2_flag=-i p2_name=Transcriptome.Index p2_numValues=1..1 p2_optional= p2_prefix= p2_prefix_when_specified= p2_type=java.io.File p2_value= p3_MODE= p3_TYPE=TEXT p3_default_value=A p3_description=The library type of the RNA-seq. This describes the relative orientation of the reads. (Default\: automatic inference of library type)\n

\nCommon Salmon options are described in contrast with equivalent options from other quantification tools.\n\n\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n\n
RSeQC Result (Majority of Reads)No clear majority1++,1--,2+-,2-+1+-,1-+,2++,2--
Salmon / SailfishIUISFISR
TopHat / Cufflinkslibrary-type fr-unstrandedlibrary-type fr-secondstrandlibrary-type fr-firststrand
HISAT2default--rna-strandedness FR-rna-strandedness RF
HTSeqstranded --nostranded --yesstranded --reverse
\n\nSee also\: https\://salmon.readthedocs.io/en/latest/salmon.html\#what-s-this-libtype p3_fileFormat= p3_flag=-l p3_name=Library.Type p3_numValues=1..1 p3_optional= p3_prefix= p3_prefix_when_specified= p3_type=java.lang.String p3_value=A\=Automatic Detection;ISF\=ISF (Inward, read 1 from the forward strand);ISR\=ISR (Inward, read 1 from the reverse strand);IU\=IU (Inward, Unstranded);OSF\=OSF (Outward, read 1 from the forward strand);OSR\=OSR (Outward, read 1 from the reverse strand);OU\=OU (Outward, Unstranded);SF\=SF (Single-End, read 1 from the forward strand);SR\=SR (Single-End, read 1 from the reverse strand);U\=U (Single-End, Unstranded) p4_MODE= p4_TYPE=TEXT p4_default_value=BOOT p4_description=Sampling method for assessing technical variance, used for downstream differential gene/transcript expression analysis with Sleuth (not needed for DESeq2).\n

\nMethods available\:
None - skips technical variance estimation
\nBootstraps (Recommended) (bootstrapped abundance estimates) - resampling (with replacement) from the counts assigned to the fragment equivalence classes, and then re-running the optimization procedure for each such sample.
\nGibbsSamples - samples are generated using posterior Gibbs sampling over the fragment equivalence classes rather than bootstrapping. p4_fileFormat= p4_flag=-e p4_name=Sampling p4_numValues=1..1 p4_optional= p4_prefix= p4_prefix_when_specified= p4_type=java.lang.String p4_value=NA\=None;BOOT\=Bootstraps;GIBB\=GibbsSamples p5_MODE= p5_TYPE=TEXT p5_default_value=true p5_description=Salmon will learn and correct for sequence-specific biases in the input data. Specifically, this model will attempt to correct for random hexamer priming bias. p5_fileFormat= p5_flag=-s p5_name=seqBias p5_numValues=1..1 p5_optional= p5_prefix= p5_prefix_when_specified= p5_type=java.lang.String p5_value=true\=TRUE;false\=FALSE p6_MODE= p6_TYPE=TEXT p6_default_value=true p6_description=Salmon learn and correct for fragment-level GC biases in the input data. Specifically, this model will attempt to correct for biases in how likely a sequence is to be observed based on its internal GC content. p6_fileFormat= p6_flag=-g p6_name=gcBias p6_numValues=1..1 p6_optional= p6_prefix= p6_prefix_when_specified= p6_type=java.lang.String p6_value=true\=TRUE;false\=FALSE p7_MODE= p7_TYPE=TEXT p7_default_value=true p7_description=Salmon will construct a model of a position-specific fragment start distribution. This is meant to model non-uniform coverage biases that are sometimes present in RNA-seq data (e.g. 5' or 3' positional bias). p7_fileFormat= p7_flag=-p p7_name=posBias p7_numValues=1..1 p7_optional= p7_prefix= p7_prefix_when_specified= p7_type=java.lang.String p7_value=true\=TRUE;false\=FALSE p8_MODE= p8_TYPE=Integer p8_default_value=30 p8_description=The number of bootstrapped estimates/Gibbs samples used for technical variance estimation p8_fileFormat= p8_flag=-n p8_name=N.Sampling p8_numValues=1..1 p8_optional= p8_prefix= p8_prefix_when_specified= p8_type=java.lang.Integer p8_value= p9_MODE= p9_TYPE=TEXT p9_default_value=off p9_description=Sets the parameters related to mapping and selective alignment to mimic alignment using Bowtie2.\n
\noff\: default\n
\nmimicBT2\: mimic alignment using Bowtie2 (with the flags --no-discordant and --no-mixed), but using the default scoring scheme and allowing both mismatches and indels in alignments.\n
\nmimicStrictBT2\: mimic alignment using Bowtie2 (with the flags suggested by RSEM), but using the default scoring scheme and allowing both mismatches and indels in alignments. These setting essentially disallow indels in the resulting alignments. p9_fileFormat= p9_flag=-t p9_name=Mimic.Bowtie p9_numValues=1..1 p9_optional= p9_prefix= p9_prefix_when_specified= p9_type=java.lang.String p9_value=off\=off;BT2\=mimicBT2;Strict\=mimicStrictBT2 privacy=public publicationDate=03/31/2022 15\:44 quality=preproduction src.repo=https\://github.com/genepattern/Salmon.Quant/tree/v0.9 taskDoc=Salmon.Quant.pdf taskType=rna-seq userid=acastanza version=Update to Salmon v1.6.0 and add Gencode Human release v39 and Mouse release vM28- beta update

- Description: Coordinated Gene Activity in Pattern Sets (CoGAPS) implements a Bayesian MCMC matrix factorization algorithm, GAPS, and links it to gene set statistic methods to infer biological process activity. It can be used to perform sparse matrix factorization on any data, and when this data represents biomolecules, to do gene set analysis. This package, PyCoGAPS, presents a unified Python interface, with a parallel, efficient underlying implementation.

cpuType=any
description=Coordinated Gene Activity in Pattern Sets (CoGAPS) implements a Bayesian MCMC matrix factorization algorithm, GAPS, and links it to gene set statistic methods to infer biological process activity. It can be used to perform sparse matrix factorization on any data, and when this data represents biomolecules, to do gene set analysis. This package, PyCoGAPS, presents a unified Python interface, with a parallel, efficient underlying implementation.
documentationUrl=https\://genepattern.github.io/PyCoGAPS/v1/index
fileFormat=pkl
job.cpuCount=
job.docker.image=fertiglab/pycogaps-gpn\:0.2.2
job.memory=64Gb
job.walltime=
language=any
name=PyCoGAPS
os=any

Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for GISTIC_2.0.

Tool Information:
- Name: GISTIC_2.0
- Version: Fixed remove.X
- Language: MATLAB
- Description: Genomic Identification of Significant Targets in Cancer (version 2.0.23)
- Repository: 

Planning Data:
{'module_name': 'GISTIC_2.0', 'parameters': [{'name': 'refgene.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The reference genome file input provides cytoband and gene location information.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'mat'}, {'name': 'seg.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The segmentation file contains the segmented data for all the samples identified by GLAD, CBS, or some other segmentation algorithm. (See GLAD file format in the Genepattern file formats documentation.) It is a six column, tab-delimited file with an optional first line identifying the columns. Positions are in base pair units.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'glad;seg;txt'}, {'name': 'markers.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The markers file identifies the marker names and positions of the markers in the original dataset (before segmentation). It is a three column, tab-delimited file with an optional header. If not already, markers are sorted by genomic position.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'cn;txt', 'prefix': '-mk'}, {'name': 'maxspace', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': "Set maxspace to generate pseudo-markers instead of creating a markers file. The param defines the maximum allowed spacing between pseudo-markers, in bases. Segments that contain fewer than this number of markers are joined to the neighboring segment that is closest in copy number. When 'markers file' is set 'maxspace' is ignored. When neither are set, generate pseudo-markers, with maxspace\\=10,000.", 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-maxspace', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'array.list.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The array list file is an optional file identifying the subset of samples to be used in the analysis. It is a one column file with an optional header. The sample identifiers listed in the array list file must match the sample names given in the segmentation file.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'alf;txt'}, {'name': 'cnv.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Specifies germline CNV (or other highly variant) regions to exclude from significance analysis. There are two forms for the cnv file\\: one allows CNVs to be identified by marker names in a single column; the other identifies excluded regions using their genomic location.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'CNV'}, {'name': 'gene.gistic', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Flag indicating that the gene GISTIC algorithm should be used to calculate the significant regions of deletion using gene locations instead of a marker locations.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '1', 'choices': '1\\=yes;0\\=no'}, {'name': 'amplifications.threshold', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Threshold for copy number amplifications. Regions with a log2 ratio above this value are considered amplified.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-ta'}, {'name': 'deletions.threshold', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Threshold for copy number deletions. Regions with a log2 ratio below the negative of this value are considered deletions.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-td'}, {'name': 'join.segment.size', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Smallest number of markers to allow in segments from the segmented data. Segments that contain a number of markers less than or equal to this number are joined to the neighboring segment that is closest in copy number.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-js'}, {'name': 'q-value.threshold', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Maximum false discovery rate for a region to be considered significant.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-qvt'}, {'name': 'remove.X', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Flag indicating whether to remove data from the X-chromosome before analysis.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'choices': '\\=(not set);1\\=yes;0\\=no', 'prefix': '-rx'}, {'name': 'cap.val', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Minimum and maximum cap values on analyzed data. Regions with a log2 ratio greater than the cap are set to the cap value; regions with a log2 ratio less than -cap value are set to -cap.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'choices': '\\=(not set);1.0\\=1.0;1.5\\=1.5;2.0\\=2.0;2.5\\=2.5;Inf\\=Inf', 'prefix': '-cap'}, {'name': 'confidence.level', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Confidence level used to calculate the region containing a driver.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0.90'}, {'name': 'run.broad.analysis', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Flag indicating whether an additional broad-level analysis should be performed.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0', 'choices': '1\\=yes;0\\=no'}, {'name': 'focal.length.cutoff', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Threshold used to distinguish broad from focal events, given in units of fraction of chromosome arm.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0.50'}, {'name': 'max.sample.segs', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Maximum number of segments allowed for a sample in the input data. Samples with more segments than this threshold are excluded from the analysis.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-maxseg'}, {'name': 'arm.peel', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Whether to perform arm level peel off. This helps separate peaks which cleans up noise.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0', 'choices': '1\\=yes;0\\=no'}, {'name': 'sample.center', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Method for centering each sample prior to the GISTIC analysis.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'choices': '\\=(not set);median;mean;none', 'prefix': '-scent'}, {'name': 'gene.collapse.method', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Method for reducing marker-level copy number data to the gene-level copy number data in the gene tables. Markers contained in the gene are used when available, otherwise the flanking marker or markers are used.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'extreme', 'choices': 'mean;median;min;max;extreme'}, {'name': 'output.prefix', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The prefix for the output file name', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-fname'}, {'name': 'logdat', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': "The '-logdat' param to apply log2 ratio for SNP arrays, default\\=autodetect", 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-logdat'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/docker-gistic\\:0.13', 'categories': '', 'task_type': 'SNP Analysis', 'author': 'Jen Dobson, Rameen Beroukhim, Gad Getz', 'command_line': 'gp_gistic2_from_seg -b . -seg <seg.file> <markers.file> <maxspace> -alf <array.list.file> -cnv <cnv.file> -refgene <refgene.file> <amplifications.threshold> <deletions.threshold> <join.segment.size> <q-value.threshold> <remove.X> <cap.val> -conf <confidence.level> -genegistic <gene.gistic> -broad <run.broad.analysis> -brlen <focal.length.cutoff> <max.sample.segs> -armpeel <arm.peel> <sample.center> -gcm <gene.collapse.method> <output.prefix> -smallmem 1 -savegene 1 -genepattern 1 -twosides 0 -saveseg 0 -savedata 0 -arb 1 -peak_type robust -smalldisk 0 -v 0 <logdat>'}

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for RenameFile.

Tool Information:
- Name: RenameFile
- Version: latest
- Language: any
- Description: Creates a result file with the contents of the input but with a new name.  Where possible, this is done without copying the file but instead by simply making a link.  While it is possible to run this with a submitted file, the common use will be to change the name of a result file or a previously uploaded file.  Note that the original file will still be present in its original location.

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for Harmony.

Tool Information:
- Name: Harmony
- Version: changed default values to be blank
- Language: any
- Description: Harmony is a batch correction tool. Upon use, this module will produce three scatterplots. One plot will show the data pre-Harmony, and can be found in the 'BeforeHarmonyPlot.png' file. In this plot, the x and y axes represent the 1st and 2nd principal components from PCA dimensional reduction (unless specified otherwise by the user). Another plot will show the data post-Harmony, and can be found in the 'AfterHarmonyPlot.png' file. In this plot, the x and y axes the same dimensions used in the pre-Harmony plot are shown, but adjusted by Harmony. Lastly, the third plot shows the pre-Harmony and post-Harmony plots side by side for comparison.
- Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/Harmony

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for HISAT2.aligner.

Tool Information:
- Name: HISAT2.aligner
- Version: Changed index dynamic source from ftp\://gpft p to the copy on https\://datasets.genepattern.org
- Language: any
- Description: HISAT2 is a fast and sensitive alignment program for mapping next-generation sequencing reads (both DNA and RNA) to a population of human genomes (as well as to a single reference genome).
- Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/HISAT2.aligner/tree/v1.5

p19_description=The maximum fragment length for valid paired-end alignments.This option is valid only with no spliced alignment. E.g. if 100 is specified and a paired-end alignment consists of two 20-bp alignments in the appropriate orientation with a 60-bp gap between them, that alignment is considered valid (as long as the minimum fragment length is also satisfied). A 61-bp gap would not be valid in that case. If trimming options -3 or -5 are also used, the  constraint is applied with respect to the untrimmed mates.\n\nThe larger the difference between minimum and maximum fragment lengths, the slower HISAT2 will run. p4_TYPE=FILE
p4_default_value=
p4_description=Second mate for paired reads. Zero or more files in FASTA or FASTQ format (bz2 and gz compressed files are supported).
p4_fileFormat=fq;fastq;fq.gz;fastq.gz;fq.bz2;fastq.bz2;fa;fasta;fa.gz;fasta.gz;fa.bz2;fasta.bz2
p4_flag=-2 
p4_name=reads.pair.2
p4_numValues=0+
p4_optional=on
p4_prefix=-2 
p4_prefix_when_specified=-2 
p4_type=java.io.File
p4_value=
p5_MODE=
p5_TYPE=Integer
p5_default_value=5
p5_description=HISAT2 searches for up to N distinct, primary alignments for each read, where N equals the integer specified with this parameter. Primary alignments mean alignments whose alignment score is equal or higher than any other alignments. It is possible that multiple distinct alignments have the same score. That is, if `2` is specified, HISAT2 will search for at most 2 distinct alignments. The alignment score for a paired-end alignment equals the sum of the alignment scores of the individual mates. Each reported read or pair alignment beyond the first has the SAM 'secondary' bit (which equals 256) set in its FLAGS field.
p5_fileFormat=
p5_flag=-k 
p5_name=max.primary.alignments
p5_numValues=1..1
p5_optional=
p5_prefix=
p5_prefix_when_specified=
p5_type=java.lang.Integer
p5_value=
p6_MODE=
p6_TYPE=Integer
p6_default_value=5
p6_description=HISAT2, like other aligners, uses seed-and-extend approaches. HISAT2 tries to extend seeds to full-length alignments. In HISAT2, --max-seeds is used to control the maximum number of seeds that will be extended. HISAT2 extends up to these many seeds and skips the rest of the seeds. Large values for <max seeds extended>` may improve alignment sensitivity, but HISAT2 is not designed with large values for<max seeds extended> in mind, and when aligning reads to long, repetitive genomes large <max seeds extended> can be very, very slow.
p6_fileFormat=
p6_flag=--max-seeds 
p6_name=max.seeds.extended
p6_numValues=0..1
p6_optional=on
p6_prefix=
p6_prefix_when_specified=
p6_type=java.lang.Integer
p6_value=
p7_MODE=
p7_TYPE=Floating Point
p7_default_value=0
p7_description=Sets the minimum value in a linear function governing the maximum number of ambiguous characters (usually `N`s and/or `.`s) allowed in a read as a function of read length. specifying `-L,0,0.15` sets the N-ceiling function `f` to `f(x) \= 0 + 0.15 * x`,\nwhere x is the read length.  See also\: [setting function options].  Reads\nexceeding this ceiling are [filtered out].  Default\: `L,0,0.15`.\n`N`s and/or `.`s) allowed in a read as a function of read length.   In these cases the user specifies three parameters\: (a) a function\ntype `F`, (b) a constant term `B`, and (c) a coefficient `A`. For instance,\nspecifying `-L,0,0.15` sets the N-ceiling function `f` to `f(x) \= 0 + 0.15 * x`,\nwhere x is the read length
p7_fileFormat=
p7_flag=
p7_name=min.n.ceil
p7_numValues=1..1
p7_optional=
p7_prefix=
p7_prefix_when_specified=
p7_type=java.lang.Float
p7_value=
p8_MODE=
p8_TYPE=Integer
p8_default_value=
p8_description=Align the first \# reads or read pairs from the input (after the `-s`/`--skip` reads or pairs have been skipped), then stop. Mainly useful for testing.
p8_fileFormat=
p8_flag=-u 
p8_name=max.reads.to.align
p8_numValues=0..1
p8_optional=on
p8_prefix=-u 
p8_prefix_when_specified=-u 
p8_type=java.lang.Integer
p8_value=
p9_MODE=
p9_TYPE=Integer
p9_default_value=2
p9_description=Sets the  minimum (`MN`) mismatch penalty. A number less than or equal to <max mismatch penalty> (`MX`) and greater than or equal to `MN` is subtracted from the alignment score for each position where a read character aligns to a reference character, the characters do not match, and neither is an `N`. If <ignore read qualities> is specified, the number subtracted quals `MX`. Otherwise, the number subtracted is `MN + floor( (MX-MN)(MIN(Q, 40.0)/40.0) )` where Q is the Phred quality value. Default\: `MX` \= 6, `MN` \= 2.
p9_fileFormat=
p9_flag=
p9_name=min.mismatch.penalty
p9_numValues=1..1
p9_optional=
p9_prefix=
p9_prefix_when_specified=
p9_type=java.lang.Integer
p9_value=

Tool Information: - Name: Seurat.IntegrateData - Version: Upgrading to Seurat V4 and fixing a bug in the command line and file name - Language: any - Description: Batch Correction for Seurat Objects - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/Seurat.BatchCorrection/tree/v3 Planning Data: {'module_name': 'Seurat.IntegrateData', 'parameters': [{'name': 'input_files', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Gene expression matrices (columns are cell IDs and rows are genes) stored in a `.txt` or one Seurat Object (`.rds`) file per batch. \\n

\\nFor sample data see \\ntest data file 1 and test data file 2.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'txt', 'num_values': '1+'}, {'name': 'use_batch_names', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': '(default \\= TRUE) Map each input file to Batch Numbers beginning with Batch 1 and going up to Batch n where n represents the number of input files.\\n

\\nWhen set to FALSE, the batch names will be set to the file names.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=TRUE;FALSE\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'ncomps', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': '(default \\= 50) The number of principal components to be used in the Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for batch correction.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '50', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'nCount_RNA', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': '(default \\= TRUE) Whether or not the batch correction script will produce a violin plot of the number of molecules detected within a cell for our single-cell datasets.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=TRUE;FALSE\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'nFeature_RNA', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': '(default \\= TRUE) Whether or not the batch correction script will produce a violin plot of the number of genes detected within each cell of our single-cell datasets.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=TRUE;FALSE\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'output_file_name', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': "(default \\= 'batch_correction_results') Base name for the .pdf and .rds output files.", 'required': True, 'default_value': 'batch_correction_results', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/seurat-suite\\:4.0.3', 'categories': 'dimension reduction;preprocess & utilities', 'task_type': 'dimension reduction', 'author': 'Jonathan Zamora and Edwin Juarez;UCSD-MesirovLab', 'command_line': 'Rscript --no-save --quiet --slave --no-restore integrate_data.R --input_files --use_batch_names --ncomps --nCount_RNA --nFeature_RNA --output_file_name '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for Salmon.Alevin.Quant. Tool Information: - Name: Salmon.Alevin.Quant - Version: Alevin 1.5.2 - beta release - Language: any - Description: Quantification and analysis of 3' tagged-end single-cell sequencing data using Salmon's Alevin (v1.5.2) function.
\n\nSee\: The Alevin Documentation\nfor detailed usage guidelines. - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/Salmon.Alevin.Quant/tree/v0.6 Planning Data: {'module_name': 'Salmon.Alevin.Quant', 'parameters': [{'name': 'Barcodes', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Cellular barcodes+UMI file(s), the FASTQ file containing CB+UMI raw sequences. Alevin also supports parsing of data from multiple files as long as the order is the same as in the "Reads" parameter.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.fastq.gz;.fq.gz;.gz;fastq;fq.gz', 'num_values': '1+'}, {'name': 'Reads', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The FASTQ file containing raw read-sequences. Alevin also supports parsing of data from multiple files as long as the order is the same as in the "Barcodes" parameter.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.fastq.gz;.fq.gz;.gz;fastq.gz;fq.gz', 'num_values': '1+'}, {'name': 'Transcriptome.Index', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'An Indexed transcriptome created with `Salmon Indexer`.
\\nMust be in .tar.gz format.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.tar.gz;tar.gz', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Chemistry', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The chemistry used by the single-cell sequencing platform.
\\nDrop-Seq, 10x Chromium v2, 10x Chromium v3, CITE-Seq, CEL-Seq, CEL-Seq2, and Quartz-Seq2 are currently supported. BD Rhapsody support is experimental.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'dropseq', 'choices': 'dropseq\\=Drop-Seq;chromium\\=10x Chromium v2;chromiumV3\\=10x Chromium v3;citeseq\\=CITE-Seq;celseq\\=CEL-Seq;celseq2\\=CEL-Seq2;quartzseq2\\=Quartz-Seq2;rhapsody\\=BD Rhapsody (Experimental)', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Library.Type', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The library type of the RNA-seq. This describes the relative orientation of paired end reads. \\n
\\nThe Alevin authors recommend using ISR (default) for both Drop-seq and Chromium chemistry.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'ISR', 'choices': 'ISF\\=ISF (Inward, read 1 from the forward strand);ISR\\=ISR (Inward, read 1 from the reverse strand);IU\\=IU (Inward, Unstranded);OSF\\=OSF (Outward, read 1 from the forward strand);OSR\\=OSR (Outward, read 1 from the reverse strand);OU\\=OU (Outward, Unstranded)', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'TgMap', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A two column tsv (tab-separated) file with no header containing the transcript to gene map file. The first column lists each transcript present in the reference, the second column lists the corresponding gene.\\n
\\nAlternatively, a .GTF file can be supplied to automatically create a transcript to gene map.\\n
', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.gtf.gz;gtf;gtf.gz;tsv;txt', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Output.Basename', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Base name to use for outputting the alevin quantification results. Should be made unique for downstream processing.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'alevin.output', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'GTF.Gene.ID.Type', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'If supplying a GTF file to automatically construct the transcript to gene map (TgMap parameter), map the transcripts to\\:
\\nthe Gene ID (GTF.Gene.ID.Type \\= gene_id) eg\\: ENSG00000141510
\\nthe Gene Symbol (GTF.Gene.ID.Type \\= gene_symbol) eg\\: TP53
\\nThis requires a GTF file to be supplied to "TgMap"', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'gene_id', 'choices': 'gene_id\\=gene_id;gene_id_noversion\\=gene_id (Drop decimal versions);gene_symbol\\=gene_symbol', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Whitelist', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': "Optionally explicitly specify the whitelist cellular barcodes to use for cell detection and cellular barcode sequence correction. If not given, alevin generates its own set of putative cellular barcodes.\\n
\\nNote\\: Not 10x 724k whitelist\\n
\\nThis flag does not use the biologically known whitelist provided by 10x, instead it's the per experiment level whitelist file e.g. the file generated by cellranger with the name barcodes.tsv.", 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'mtRNA', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The list of mitochondrial genes which are to be used as a feature for cellular barcode whitelising naive Bayes classification.\\n
\\nNote\\: \\n\\nIt is generally advisable to not use nuclear mitrochondrial genes in this as they can be both up and/or down regulated which might cancel out the usefulness of this feature. Please check issue \\#367 in salmon repo to know more about it.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'mtRNA.From.GTF', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'If supplying a GTF file to automatically construct the transcript to gene map (TgMap parameter), automatically construct the mtRNA list from the GTF directly.\\n
\\nNote\\: if set to true, this will override the list supplied to the "mtRNA" parameter.\\n
\\nThis requires a GTF file to be supplied to "TgMap"', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'FALSE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=true;FALSE\\=false', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'rRNA', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The list of ribosomal genes which are to be used as a feature for cellular barcode whitelising naive Bayes classification.\\n
', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'rRNA.From.GTF', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'If supplying a GTF file to automatically construct the transcript to gene map (TgMap parameter), automatically construct the rRNA list from the GTF directly.\\n
\\nNote\\: if set to true, this will override the list supplied to the "rRNA" parameter.\\n
\\nThis requires a GTF file to be supplied to "TgMap"', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'FALSE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=true;FALSE\\=false', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'dumpMTX', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Convert the default binary format of alevin for gene-count matrix into a human readable mtx (matrix market exchange) sparse format. Generates a new output called quants_mat.mtx in the compressed output folder.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'FALSE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=true;FALSE\\=false', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'expectCells', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'This command line flag uses the cellranger type white-listing procedure. As specified in their algorithm overview page, "All barcodes whose total UMI counts exceed m/10 are called as cells", where m is the frequency of the top 1% cells as specified by the parameter of this command line flag.\\n
\\nNote\\: Setting this parameter to "0" disables this option and, unless forceCells is specified, instead uses the default Alevin knee calculation heuristics.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'forceCells', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'By default, Alevin performs a heuristic based initial cellular barcode white-listing by finding the knee in the distribution of the barcode frequency. With this flag, by looking at the barcode frequency distribution, a user can explicitly specify the number of CB to consider for initial white-listing.\\n
\\nNote\\: Setting this parameter to "0" disables this option and, unless expectCells is specified, instead uses the default Alevin knee calculation heuristics.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'dumpFeatures', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'If activated, alevin dumps all the features used by the CB classification and their counts at each cell level. Generally used in pair with other flags.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=true;FALSE\\=false', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'numCellBootstraps', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Estimate the inferential uncertainty in the estimation of per cell level gene count matrix by performing bootstrapping of the reads in per-cell level equivalence classes, and generate the mean and variance of the count matrix. This option generates three additional files, namely, quants_mean_mat.gz, quants_var_mat.gz and quants_boot_rows.txt. The format of the files stay the same as quants_mat.gz while the row order is saved in quants_boot_rows.txt and the column order is stays the same as in file quants_mat_cols.txt.
\\nSet the number of bootstrap estimates to perform (0 \\= flag will not be passed to alevin). dumpFeatures must be set to "true".', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0', 'num_values': '0..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/salmon-alevin-quant\\:beta', 'categories': 'rna-seq;single-cell', 'task_type': 'rna-seq', 'author': 'Anthony S. Castanza;UCSD-MesirovLab', 'command_line': 'salmon_alevin_quant.sh -b -q -i -c -l -t -z -u -w -m -n -r -s -x -e -f -d -a -j '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

\nMust be in .tar.gz format. p3_fileFormat=.tar.gz;tar.gz p3_flag=-i p3_name=Transcriptome.Index p3_numValues=1..1 p3_optional= p3_prefix= p3_prefix_when_specified= p3_type=java.io.File p3_value= p4_MODE= p4_TYPE=TEXT p4_default_value=dropseq p4_description=The chemistry used by the single-cell sequencing platform.

BD Rhapsody support is experimental. p4_fileFormat= p4_flag=-c p4_name=Chemistry p4_numValues=1..1 p4_optional= p4_prefix= p4_prefix_when_specified= p4_type=java.lang.String p4_value=dropseq\=Drop-Seq;chromium\=10x Chromium v2;chromiumV3\=10x Chromium v3;citeseq\=CITE-Seq;celseq\=CEL-Seq;celseq2\=CEL-Seq2;quartzseq2\=Quartz-Seq2;rhapsody\=BD Rhapsody (Experimental) p5_MODE= p5_TYPE=TEXT p5_default_value=ISR p5_description=The library type of the RNA-seq. This describes the relative orientation of paired end reads. \n
\nThe Alevin authors recommend using ISR (default) for both Drop-seq and Chromium chemistry. p5_fileFormat= p5_flag=-l p5_name=Library.Type p5_numValues=1..1 p5_optional= p5_prefix= p5_prefix_when_specified= p5_type=java.lang.String p5_value=ISF\=ISF (Inward, read 1 from the forward strand);ISR\=ISR (Inward, read 1 from the reverse strand);IU\=IU (Inward, Unstranded);OSF\=OSF (Outward, read 1 from the forward strand);OSR\=OSR (Outward, read 1 from the reverse strand);OU\=OU (Outward, Unstranded) p6_MODE=IN p6_TYPE=FILE p6_choices=http\://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_mouse/release_M26/gencode.vM26.annotation.gtf.gz\=Mouse_Gencode_vM26;http\://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/gencode/Gencode_human/release_37/gencode.v37.annotation.gtf.gz\=Human_Gencode_v37 p6_default_value= p6_description=A two column tsv (tab-separated) file with no header containing the transcript to gene map file. The first column lists each transcript present in the reference, the second column lists the corresponding gene.\n
\nAlternatively, a .GTF file can be supplied to automatically create a transcript to gene map.\n
p6_fileFormat=.gtf.gz;gtf;gtf.gz;tsv;txt p6_flag=-t p6_name=TgMap p6_numValues=1..1 p6_optional= p6_prefix= p6_prefix_when_specified= p6_type=java.io.File p6_value= p7_MODE= p7_TYPE=TEXT p7_default_value=alevin.output p7_description=Base name to use for outputting the alevin quantification results. Should be made unique for downstream processing. p7_fileFormat= p7_flag=-z p7_name=Output.Basename p7_numValues=1..1 p7_optional= p7_prefix= p7_prefix_when_specified= p7_type=java.lang.String p7_value= p8_MODE= p8_TYPE=TEXT p8_default_value=gene_id p8_description=If supplying a GTF file to automatically construct the transcript to gene map (TgMap parameter), map the transcripts to\:
\nthe Gene ID (GTF.Gene.ID.Type \= gene_id) eg\: ENSG00000141510
\nthe Gene Symbol (GTF.Gene.ID.Type \= gene_symbol) eg\: TP53
\nThis requires a GTF file to be supplied to "TgMap" p8_fileFormat= p8_flag=-u p8_name=GTF.Gene.ID.Type p8_numValues=1..1 p8_optional= p8_prefix= p8_prefix_when_specified= p8_type=java.lang.String p8_value=gene_id\=gene_id;gene_id_noversion\=gene_id (Drop decimal versions);gene_symbol\=gene_symbol p9_MODE=IN p9_TYPE=FILE p9_default_value= p9_description=Optionally explicitly specify the whitelist cellular barcodes to use for cell detection and cellular barcode sequence correction. If not given, alevin generates its own set of putative cellular barcodes.\n
\nNote\: Not 10x 724k whitelist\n
\nThis flag does not use the biologically known whitelist provided by 10x, instead it's the per experiment level whitelist file e.g. the file generated by cellranger with the name barcodes.tsv. p9_fileFormat= p9_flag=-w p9_name=Whitelist p9_numValues=0..1 p9_optional=on p9_prefix= p9_prefix_when_specified= p9_type=java.io.File p9_value= privacy=public publicationDate=08/26/2021 10\:40 quality=preproduction src.repo=https\://github.com/genepattern/Salmon.Alevin.Quant/tree/v0.6 taskDoc=Salmon.Alevin.Quant.pdf taskType=rna-seq userid=bhill@broadinstitute.org version=Alevin 1.5.2 - beta release

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for MutPanning. Tool Information: - Name: MutPanning - Version: Initial Release - Language: any - Description: MutPanning identifies driver genes based on their abundance of nonsynonymous mutations and their increased number of mutations in unusual nucleotide contexts that deviate from the background mutational process. - Repository: Planning Data: {'module_name': 'MutPanning', 'parameters': [{'name': 'mutation.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The mutation file should be a tab-delimited standard *.maf format and contain the following columns\\: Hugo_Symbol (gene name), Chromosome, Start_Position (according to Hg19), End_Position (according to Hg19), Strand (1 or -1), Variant_Classification (e.g. Missense_Mutation, Nonsense_Mutation, In_Frame_Del, Silent, etc.), Variant_Type (e.g. SNP, DEL, INS, etc.), Reference_Allele (reference nucleotide in Hg19), Tumor_Seq_Allele1 (allele A in tumor), Tumor_Seq_Allele2 (allele B in tumor), Tumor_Sample_Barcode.
Names in column Tumor_Sample_Barcode should exactly match the names in the sample file (case-sensitive). If you are unsure about the file format, you can download an example here. Make sure that Variant_Classification and Variant_Type are annotated by exactly the same terms/names as in the exemplary mutation file (case-sensitive, hyphenation, underscores, etc.)', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'maf', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'sample.annotation.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The sample annotation file should be a tab-delimited *.txt file that contains at least two columns labeled Sample and Cohort. The Sample column contains unique sample name for each sample in the maf file. No duplicates allowed, all samples in the mutation file must be listed in the sample file. The cohort column contains the subcohort (e.g. cancer type) to which the sample belongs (case-sensitive). If you are unsure about the file format, you can download an exemplary sample file here', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'txt', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'min.samples.per.cluster', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Minimum number of samples needed per nucleotide context cluster. Unless you are familiar with the MutPanning algorithm, we recommend running MutPanning with standard parameters (default value 3).', 'required': True, 'default_value': '3', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'min.mutations.per.cluster', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Minimum number of mutations needed per nucleotide context cluster. instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for tfsites.VisualizeTFSitesOnSequences.

Tool Information:
- Name: tfsites.VisualizeTFSitesOnSequences
- Version: Updated docker container to v17.0.19.
- Language: any
- Description: Annotates transcription factor binding sites across a DNA sequence with optional motif database generation. Multiple transcription factors can be analyzed. Each binding site is labeled with a unique binding site ID and its start and end position. If reference data is provided for a transcription factor, the affinity/score of this site will be labeled and the intensity of the binding site's color will be proportional. At least one of affinity information and files or batch motif files (or both) must be provided. If motif database parameters are provided, it will first generate a motif database and use it for visualization.
- Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/tfsites.VisualizeTFSitesOnSequences/

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for eREVEALER.

Tool Information:
- Name: eREVEALER
- Version: make it public
- Language: any
- Description: eREVEALER (enhanced Repeated Evaluation of VariablEs conditionAL Entropy and Redundancy) is an analysis method specifically suited to find groups of genomic alterations that match in a complementary way, a predefined functional activation, dependency of drug response target profile. The method starts by considering, if available, already known genomic alterations (seed) that are the known causes or are known or assumed associated with the target. REVEALER starts by finding the genomic alteration that best matches the target profile conditional to the known seed profile using the conditional mutual information. The newly discovered alteration is then merged with the seed to form a new summary feature, and then the process repeats itself finding additional complementary alterations that explain more and more of the target profile.

Tool Information:

- Description: eREVEALER (enhanced Repeated Evaluation of VariablEs conditionAL Entropy and Redundancy) is an analysis method specifically suited to find groups of genomic alterations that match in a complementary way, a predefined functional activation, dependency of drug response target profile. The method starts by considering, if available, already known genomic alterations (seed) that are the known causes or are known or assumed associated with the target. REVEALER starts by finding the genomic alteration that best matches the target profile conditional to the known seed profile using the conditional mutual information. The newly discovered alteration is then merged with the seed to form a new summary feature, and then the process repeats itself finding additional complementary alterations that explain more and more of the target profile.

cpuType=any
description=eREVEALER (enhanced Repeated Evaluation of VariablEs conditionAL Entropy and Redundancy) is an analysis method specifically suited to find groups of genomic alterations that match in a complementary way, a predefined functional activation, dependency of drug response target profile. The method starts by considering, if available, already known genomic alterations (seed) that are the known causes or are known or assumed associated with the target. REVEALER starts by finding the genomic alteration that best matches the target profile conditional to the known seed profile using the conditional mutual information. The newly discovered alteration is then merged with the seed to form a new summary feature, and then the process repeats itself finding additional complementary alterations that explain more and more of the target profile.
