instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for spatialGE.STgradient. Tool Information: - Name: spatialGE.STgradient - Version: Fixing prerelease - Language: R - Description: Tests for genes for which there is evidence of expression spatial gradients with respect to a "reference" tissue niche/domain (e.g., higher expression closer to reference tissue niche, lower expression as farther from reference tissue niche).

If you just ran spatialGE.STclust, you probably want the spatialGE.STgradient.Launcher module instead. - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/spatialGE.STgradient Planning Data: {'module_name': 'spatialGE.STgradient', 'parameters': [{'name': 'input.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Normalized spatial transcriptomics data with clusters, coming from the spatialGE.STclust module.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'rds', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'samples', 'type': 'String', 'description': 'Comma-separated list of sample names to include. If left blank, all samples will be used.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-s', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'num.variable.genes', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum number of genes per sample to test for spatial gradients. The genes to be tested are selected based on standard deviation.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '3000', 'num_values': '1'}, {'name': 'annotation.to.test', 'type': 'String', 'description': 'The tissue niches on which to run STgradient. This parameter should be set to the name of a column in @spatial_meta containing the tissue domain assignments for each spot or cell. These are generated by STclust. If left blank, STgradient will be run for all tissue niches.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-a', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'reference.cluster', 'type': 'String', 'description': 'Reference cluster from which spatial gradients are to be tested. The reference cluster could be, for example, a tumor region detected by STclust. One of the tissue domains in the niche specified in annotation to test. Corresponds to the "reference" cluster or domain. Spearman\'s correlations will be calculated using spots assigned to domains other than this reference domain (or domains specified in exclude clusters). If left blank, values will be individually calculated for all possible tissue domains.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-c', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'exclude.clusters', 'type': 'String', 'description': "Comma-separated list of clusters to exclude. Exclude regions/niches from the analysis. By specifying one or more niches, the distances of those spots/cells will not be calculated and will be excluded from the analyses. This option could be useful when removing tissue niches that show necrosis and could add noise to the Spearman's coefficients.", 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-e', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'robust.regression', 'type': 'String', 'description': 'In robust regression, outliers are given less weight towards the calculation of the regression coefficient.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'True', 'choices': 'False\\=False;True\\=True', 'num_values': '1'}, {'name': 'ignore.outliers', 'type': 'String', 'description': 'Whether to ignore outliers. This option is ignored if robust regression is selected. If outliers are ignored, traditional linear regression is carried out after removing spots/cells defined as outliers by the interquartile range method. If set to false, all spots are considered in the analysis.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'False', 'choices': 'False\\=False;True\\=True', 'num_values': '1'}, {'name': 'correlation.limit', 'type': 'Float', 'description': 'A distance value to restrict the correlation analysis. Some tissues can be very heterogeneous in composition. As a result it could be reasonable to test for spatial gradients within a restricted area of the tissue.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-l', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'min.neighbors', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'The minimum number of immediate neighbors a reference spot/cell must have to be included in the analysis. This parameter intends to reduce the effect of isolated spots/cells in the calculation of the correlation coefficients. Unsupervised clustering algorithms (such as STclust) can assign niches to isolated spots. Reference spots with less neighbors than specified, will be omitted from the analysis, and hence distances from that spot will not be calculated.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '3', 'num_values': '1'}, {'name': 'distance.summary', 'type': 'String', 'description': "Distance summary metric\\: 'average' or 'minimum'", 'required': True, 'default_value': 'min', 'choices': 'min\\=Minimum;avg\\=Average', 'num_values': '1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/spatialge-stgradient\\:0.2', 'categories': 'spatial transcriptomics', 'task_type': 'spatial transcriptomics', 'author': 'Thorin Tabor;UCSD - Mesirov Lab', 'command_line': 'Rscript /spatialGE/wrapper.R -f -v -r -i -n -d '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.
output:

If left blank, all samples will be used. p2_fileFormat= p2_flag= p2_name=samples p2_numValues=0..1 p2_optional=on p2_prefix= p2_prefix_when_specified=-s p2_type=java.lang.String p2_value= p3_MODE= p3_TYPE=Integer p3_default_value=3000 p3_description=Maximum number of genes per sample to test for spatial gradients. The genes to be tested are selected based on standard deviation. p3_fileFormat= p3_flag=-v p3_name=num.variable.genes p3_numValues=1 p3_optional= p3_prefix= p3_prefix_when_specified= p3_type=java.lang.Integer p3_value= p4_MODE=IN p4_TYPE=String p4_default_value= p4_description=The tissue niches on which to run STgradient. This parameter should be set to the name of a column in @spatial_meta containing the tissue domain assignments for each spot or cell. These are generated by STclust. If left blank, STgradient will be run for all tissue niches. p4_fileFormat= p4_flag= p4_name=annotation.to.test p4_numValues=0..1 p4_optional=on p4_prefix= p4_prefix_when_specified=-a p4_type=java.lang.String p4_value= p5_MODE= p5_TYPE=String p5_default_value= p5_description=Reference cluster from which spatial gradients are to be tested. The reference cluster could be, for example, a tumor region detected by STclust. One of the tissue domains in the niche specified in annotation to test. Corresponds to the "reference" cluster or domain. Spearman's correlations will be calculated using spots assigned to domains other than this reference domain (or domains specified in exclude clusters). If left blank, values will be individually calculated for all possible tissue domains. p5_fileFormat= p5_flag= p5_name=reference.cluster p5_numValues=0..1 p5_optional=on p5_prefix= p5_prefix_when_specified=-c p5_type=java.lang.String p5_value= p6_MODE= p6_TYPE=String p6_default_value= p6_description=Comma-separated list of clusters to exclude. 		_description\="'Takes a 'column slice' from a .res, .gct, .odf, or .cls file.'"
		input.filename\="'<GenePatternURL>getFile.jsp?task%3D<LSID>&file%3DmiGCM_218.mal.cls'"
		columns\="'6-20, 34-41, 54-67, 79-107, 121-129'"
		output\="'<input.filename_basename>.slice'"/>
	<task	name\="'SelectFeaturesColumns'"
		id\="3"
		LSID\="urn\:lsid\:broad.mit.edu\:cancer.software.genepattern.module.analysis\:00021\:3"
		_description\="'Takes a 'column slice' from a .res, .gct, .odf, or .cls file.'"
		input.filename\="'<GenePatternURL>getFile.jsp?task%3D<LSID>&file%3DmiGCM_218.tt.cls'"
		columns\="'6-20, 34-41, 54-67, 79-107, 121-129'"
		output\="'<input.filename_basename>.slice'"/>
	<task	name\="'PreprocessDataset'"
		id\="4"
		LSID\="urn\:lsid\:broad.mit.edu\:cancer.software.genepattern.module.analysis\:00020\:2"
		_description\="'Performs several preprocessing options on a res, gct, or Dataset input file'"

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for tximport.DESeq2. Tool Information: - Name: tximport.DESeq2 - Version: latest - Language: any - Description: Imports RNA-seq quantifications from frequently used pipelines using the tximport package and outputs a DESeq2 "normalized counts" file in .GCT format suitable for use with GSEA, and/or a TPM .GCT suitable for ssGSEA.
\nIf a Sample Info file is provided containing assignments of samples to phenotypes, gene level differential expression will be calculated using DESeq2 for the two phenotypes. - Repository: Planning Data: {'module_name': 'tximport.DESeq2', 'parameters': [{'name': 'Quantifications', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Output files from the respective pipeline. Files must be named with the sample ID and the appropriate extension for the quantification tool.\\n
\\nExample\\:\\n".genes.results" files output from RSEM\\: Sample_1.genes.results\\n
\\n".quant.sf" or ".quant.sf.gz" files output from Salmon/Sailfish\\: Sample_1.quant.sf/Sample_1.quant.sf.gz\\n
\\n".abundance.h5" or ".abundance.tsv" files output from Kallisto\\: Sample_1.abundance.h5/Sample_1.abundance.h5.gz/Sample_1.abundance.tsv/Sample_1.abundance.tsv.gz\\n

\\nAll files must have been quantified using the same application and the same transcriptome.\\n
\\nSupports gzip (.gz) files.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'gz;h5;results;sf;tsv', 'num_values': '1+'}, {'name': 'Sample.Info', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Optional tab delimited text file containing Sample ID to Phenotype mappings. Sample IDs should match exactly the ID used in the input file (without the file extension).
\\nIf provided, this file will be used to compute deferentially expressed genes using DESeq2.\\n
By default, Log2(FC) will be calculated for the first Factor level vs the second Factor level (Phenotype_A vs. Phenotype_B).\\n

\\n\\n\\n\\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n \\n\\n
SampleIDFactor
Sample_1Phenotype_A
Sample_2Phenotype_A
Sample_3Phenotype_B
Sample_4Phenotype_B
\\n
\\nCovariates can be provided as additional "Factor" columns. The first factor column (the second column in the table) will always be used as the primary factor for the differential expression analysis.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'txt', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Quant.Type', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Select the type of quantifications to be imported.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'SALMON', 'choices': 'RSEM\\=RSEM .genes.results;SALMON\\=Salmon .quant.sf;SAILFISH\\=Sailfish .quant.sf;KallistoH5\\=Kallisto .abundance.h5;KallistoTSV\\=Kallisto .abundance.tsv', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Transcriptome.Database', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'For Salmon/Sailfish/Kallisto data providing the transcriptome file used to quantify the data is required and must be provided in GTF/GFF3 format. This parameter is not utilized for RSEM data.
(Supports gzip [.gz] files).
', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'gff3;gtf;gz', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Output.Normalized.Counts', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Compute count normalization with DESeq2 and output the normalized matrix. This is the ideal output for compatibility with GSEA.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=TRUE;FALSE\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Output.TPM', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Transcripts per million (TPM) quantifications will be extracted and output. This is the ideal output for compatibility with ssGSEA.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=TRUE;FALSE\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'output.file.base', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The base name of the output file(s). File extensions will be added automatically.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'Merged.Data', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Reverse.Sign', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'If computing differentially expressed genes, by default, Log2(FC) will be calculated for the first Factor level vs the second Factor level (Phenotype_A vs. Phenotype_B). Setting Reverse.Sign \\= TRUE will reverse the direction of the calculation and Log2(FC) will be calculated for the second Factor level vs the first Factor level (Phenotype_B vs. Phenotype_A).', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'FALSE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=TRUE;FALSE\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Annotate.DEGs', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'If a Sample Info file and a Transcriptome Database have been provided, setting Annotate DEGs to TRUE will attempt to add gene symbols to the computed differential expression analysis.
Note\\: This does not affect the .GCT files which will still output only the underlying Gene IDs.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=TRUE;FALSE\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Split.Identifiers', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Some pipelines produce a gene label that combines a reference ID and a Gene Symbol joined by an underscore (e.g. ENSG00000141510_TP53).\\n
\\nTRUE will attempt to split these into the reference ID and the Gene Symbol. The reference ID will be used as the NAME column of the GCT and the Gene Symbol will be used as the Description.\\n
\\nFALSE will leave the identifiers as-is.\\n', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=TRUE;FALSE\\=FALSE', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Min.Count.Filter', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Keep genes with more than counts summed over all samples (default\\: 1 count; 0 \\= disabled)', 'required': True, 'default_value': '1', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'random.seed', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Integer used to configure the workspace. Setting this to a constant ensures uniformity for any operations that use random numbers.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '779948241', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/tximport_deseq2\\:1.0', 'categories': 'differential expression', 'task_type': 'differential expression', 'author': 'Anthony S. Castanza;UCSD-MesirovLab', 'command_line': ' tximport.deseq2.R --quant\\= --type\\= --txdb\\= --info\\= --counts\\= --tpm\\= --basename\\= --annotate\\= --reverse\\= --split\\= --filter\\= --seed\\='} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

Castanza;UCSD-MesirovLab categories=differential expression commandLine= tximport.deseq2.R --quant\= --type\= --txdb\= --info\= --counts\= --tpm\= --basename\= --annotate\= --reverse\= --split\= --filter\= --seed\= cpuType=any description=Imports RNA-seq quantifications from frequently used pipelines using the tximport package and outputs a DESeq2 "normalized counts" file in .GCT format suitable for use with GSEA, and/or a TPM .GCT suitable for ssGSEA.

\nTRUE will attempt to split these into the reference ID and the Gene Symbol. The reference ID will be used as the NAME column of the GCT and the Gene Symbol will be used as the Description.\n
\nFALSE will leave the identifiers as-is.\n p10_fileFormat= p10_flag=--split p10_name=Split.Identifiers p10_numValues=1..1 p10_optional= p10_prefix= p10_prefix_when_specified= p10_type=java.lang.String p10_value=TRUE\=TRUE;FALSE\=FALSE p11_MODE= p11_TYPE=Integer p11_default_value=1 p11_description=Keep genes with more than counts summed over all samples (default\: 1 count; 0 \= disabled) p11_fileFormat= p11_flag=--filter p11_name=Min.Count.Filter p11_numValues=1..1 p11_optional= p11_prefix= p11_prefix_when_specified= p11_range=0+ p11_type=java.lang.Integer p11_value= p12_MODE= p12_TYPE=TEXT p12_default_value=779948241 p12_description=Integer used to configure the workspace. Setting this to a constant ensures uniformity for any operations that use random numbers. p12_fileFormat= p12_flag=--seed p12_name=random.seed p12_numValues=1..1 p12_optional= p12_prefix= p12_prefix_when_specified= p12_type=java.lang.String p12_value= p1_MODE=IN p1_TYPE=FILE p1_default_value= p1_description=Output files from the respective pipeline. Files must be named with the sample ID and the appropriate extension for the quantification tool.\n
\nExample\:\n".genes.results" files output from RSEM\: Sample_1.genes.results\n
\n".quant.sf" or ".quant.sf.gz" files output from Salmon/Sailfish\: Sample_1.quant.sf/Sample_1.quant.sf.gz\n
\n".abundance.h5" or ".abundance.tsv" files output from Kallisto\: Sample_1.abundance.h5/Sample_1.abundance.h5.gz/Sample_1.abundance.tsv/Sample_1.abundance.tsv.gz\n

\nAll files must have been quantified using the same application and the same transcriptome.\n

instruction:

Tool Information:

- Description: A proteomics method to propogate identifed peptides across multiple MS runs

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for spatialGE.STgradient.Launcher.

Tool Information:
- Name: spatialGE.STgradient.Launcher
- Version: Initial version
- Language: Javascript
- Description: Reads the output of spatialGE.STclust and then launches an analysis to test for genes for which there is evidence of expression spatial gradients with respect to a "reference" tissue niche/domain (e.g., higher expression closer to reference tissue niche, lower expression as farther from reference tissue niche).
- Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/spatialGE.STgradient.Launcher.git

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for AmpliconSuite. Tool Information: - Name: AmpliconSuite - Version: Changed cnvkit-segmentation default to cbs and increased default job memory - Language: any - Description: A multithread-enabled quickstart tool for AmpliconArchitect. Performs all preliminary steps (alignment, CNV calling, seed interval detection) required prior to running AmpliconArchitect. PrepareAA supports hg19 (or GRCh37), hg38 as well as mouse genome mm10 (or GRCm38). PrepareAA can also be invoked to start at intermediate stages of the data preparation process.\n
\nAll credits go to\: https\://github.com/AmpliconSuite/AmpliconSuite-pipeline \n
\nView licenses here\: https\://github.com/genepattern/AmpliconSuite\#licenses\n
\n

\nTo increase your GenePattern disk space quote so you can more easily upload the input bam files, click here to join the AmpliconSuiteUsers group on this server.

\n \nTo run multiple samples at once, simply drag and drop multiple samples into the input options. There is no need to check the "Batch" box. \n\n
\nCurrently using Amplicon Suite version 1.3.8. - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/AmpliconSuite Planning Data: {'module_name': 'AmpliconSuite', 'parameters': [{'name': 'bam.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Please provide the BAM file. There should only be one of a single bam file, 2 fastqs or a single zipped output from a previous run.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'BAM;bam', 'prefix': '--bam', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'fastq.r1', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'First FASTQ file. There should only be one of a single bam file, 2 fastqs or a single zipped output from a previous run.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.fastq.gz', 'prefix': '--fastqs', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'fastq.r2', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Second FASTQ file. There should only be one of a single bam file, 2 fastqs or a single zipped output from a previous run.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.fastq.gz', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Sample.Name', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Name of the sample being run. Also used as the output prefix.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'RUN.AA', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Would you like to run AA at the end? Will return AA results at the end if Yes. If no, will return files necessary to input to AA. Default to "Yes", user can select "No".', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'Yes', 'choices': 'Yes\\=Yes;No\\=No', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'RUN.AC', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Whether or not to run Amplicon Classifier. Default to "Yes", user can select "No".', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'Yes', 'choices': 'Yes\\=Yes;No\\=No', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'reference', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Reference genome. Please use drop down to select.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'GRCh38', 'choices': 'hg19\\=hg19;GRCh37\\=GRCh37;GRCh38\\=GRCh38;mm10\\=mm10;GRCh38_viral\\=GRCh38_viral', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'cnvkit.segmentation', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Segmentation method for CNVKit (if used), defaults to CNVKit default segmentation method (cbs). Use drop down menu to select.', 'required': False, 'default_value': 'cbs', 'choices': 'cbs\\=cbs;haar\\=haar;hmm\\=hmm;hmm-tumor\\=hmm-tumor;hmm-germline\\=hmm-germline;none\\=none', 'prefix': '--cnvkit_segmentation', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'project.key', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Project key on ampliconrepository.org, found under the key icon on the project page for project owners.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '--project_key', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'cnv.bed', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'BED file (or CNVKit .cns file) of CNV changes. Fields in the bed file should be\\: chr start end name cngain', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'bed', 'prefix': '--cnv_bed', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'AA.seed', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The seed that sets randomness for Amplicon Architect', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '--AA_seed', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'normal_bam', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Path to a matched normal bam for CNVKit (optional).', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'bam', 'prefix': '--normal_bam', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'VCF.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Provide a VCF file of externally-called SVs to augment SVs identified by AA internally.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '--sv_vcf', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'VCF.no.filter', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': "Use all external SV calls from the VCF file, even those without 'PASS' in the FILTER column.", 'required': False, 'default_value': 'No', 'choices': 'Yes\\=Yes;No\\=No', 'prefix': '--sv_vcf_no_filter', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'CN.gain', 'type': 'Floating Point', 'description': 'Copy number gain threshold to consider for AA seeding.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '4.5', 'prefix': '--cngain', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Minimum.copy.number.size', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'CN interval size (in bp) to consider for AA seeding', 'required': False, 'default_value': '50000', 'prefix': '--cnsize_min', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Downsample.Argument', 'type': 'Floating Point', 'description': 'Set a custom threshold for bam coverage downsampling during AA. instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for STAR.aligner. Tool Information: - Name: STAR.aligner - Version: Adding support for gzipped input data - Language: C++ - Description: STAR (Spliced Transcripts Alignment to a Reference) 2.7.10b is a fast RNA-seq reads to genome mapper. It differs from other mappers as TopHat in that it gains speed at the expense of consuming more RAM and that it incorporates transcriptome annotation at the indexing build stage rather than at the analysis stage. It can optionally detect non-canonical splices and chimeric transcripts. - Repository: Planning Data: {'module_name': 'STAR.aligner', 'parameters': [{'name': 'star.index', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A STAR index. Select a prebuilt index from https\\://datasets.genepattern.org/?prefix\\=data/module_support_files/STAR/ or upload your own as a ZIP file (you can make one using STAR.indexer).', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'zip', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'reads.pair.1', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Unpaired reads or first mate for paired reads, as files in fastA or fastQ format. You can provide several files.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'fa;fasta;fastq;fq', 'num_values': '1+'}, {'name': 'reads.pair.2', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Second mate for paired reads.

The files and the sequences inside the files must be in the same order as for the first mates.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'fa;fasta;fastq;fq', 'prefix': '--reads2', 'num_values': '0+'}, {'name': 'max.reads.to.align', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Set this if you want to map only a selected set of reads at the top of the input (mainly useful for testing).', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '--mapN', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'align.read.end.to.end', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Align reads end to end and count all mistmatches. The default is to use instead "soft clipping" at both 5\'- and 3\'-end, that means to make a local alignment and ignore the contribution of the ends of the read to the final score if this improves the score. This can be useful for ChIP-seq and other DNA sequencing applications with reads that have already been quality-trimmed.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'no', 'choices': 'yes\\=yes;no\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'max.number.mismatches', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum number of mismatches per read. Note that a mate pair is counted as one read.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '10', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'max.fraction.mistaches', 'type': 'Floating Point', 'description': 'Maximum number of mismatches per read, expressed as the proportion between the number of mismatches and the mapped length of the read. Note that a mate pair is counted as one read.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0.3', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'min.overhang.annotated.read', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Minimum length that read must map at both sides of splice junction in order to accept mapping to a splice junction that is annotated in GTF of tab file.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '3', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'min.overhang.not.annotated.read', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Minimum length that read must map at both sides of splice junction in order to accept de novo discovery of splice junction.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '5', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'min.intron.length', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Minimum size of intron. A gap in the alignment between a read and the genome that is smaller is considered a deletion, not an intron.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '21', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'max.intron.length', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum size of intron. If a read aligns to the genome with a gap larger than this it is considered a chimeric read. The default value of 500,000 is fine-tuned to mammalian genomes, for plant and yeast genomes you will have to decrease it.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '500000', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'mates.max.gap', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum distance between mate pair reads. If reads map to the genome farther apart the fragment is considered to be chimeric. The default value of 500,000 is fine-tuned to mammalian genomes, for plant and yeast genomes you will have to decrease it.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '500000', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'secondary.mapping.mismatches.range', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'By default STAR only reports reads that map to multiple locations on the genome when they map with the highest possible score. You can ask STAR to report also secondary mappings with up to this much more mismatches than the primary mappings.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '0', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'max.multimapping', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Do not report reads that map to more than that many different locations on the genome.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '10', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'min.report.canonical.junction.overhang', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Criterium for reporting de novo predicted splice junctions in the SJ.tab.out file \\: for canonical splice sites at least one read with at least this overhang is needed.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '12', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'min.report.noncanonical.junction.overhang', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Criterium for reporting de novo predicted splice junctions in the SJ.tab.out file \\: for noncanonical splice sites at least 3 reads with at least this overhang are needed.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '30', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'map.only.reported.juntions', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'By default all mapped reads are output in the SAM/BAM file. Set this to yes if you want to bring the SAM/BAM file in agreement with the SJ.tab.out file, by outputting only reads that are not spliced or map to splice junctions that are annotated or have been de novo predicted.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'no', 'choices': 'yes\\=yes;no\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'two.pass', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Run STAR in 2-pass mode, that is, run STAR a first time, merge the found splice junctions with the splice junction annotation in the index, and run STAR a second time. Consult the documentation for more explanation.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'no', 'choices': 'yes\\=yes;no\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'detect.chimeric.transcripts', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': '', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'no', 'choices': 'yes\\=yes;no\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'output.unmapped.reads', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': '', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'no', 'choices': 'yes\\=yes;no\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'quantify.genes', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Write a table with number of reads mapped per gene and a supplementary BAM file with mappings to transcriptome instead of to genome coordinates.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'no', 'choices': 'yes\\=yes;no\\=no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'output.wiggle.file', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Output a "wiggle" file for viewing in viewers like IGV or UCSC genome browser.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'None', 'choices': 'None\\=none;bedGraph\\=file in BedGraph format;wiggle\\=file in WIG format', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'wiggle.signal', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'From which bases to generate the signal for the "wiggle" file. By default they are all used, but you can choose to use only the bases at the 5\'-end of the 1st read (useful for CAGE/RAMPAGE) or only from the 2nd mate from read pairs.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'all', 'choices': "all\\=all;read1_5p\\=only 5' from read 1;read2\\=only from read 2", 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'output.format', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': '', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'SAM', 'choices': 'SAM\\=SAM unsorted;BAM Unsorted\\=BAM unsorted ;BAM SortedByCoordinate\\=BAM sorted by coordinate', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'HI.flag', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Number of "hits" with higest score to label as "primary" in the SAM/BAM file. If you choose "only one" the others are labeled as "secondary" (all reads that map with lower than the highest score are labeled "secondary").', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'OneBestScore', 'choices': 'OneBestScore\\=only one;AllBestScore\\=all', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'output.prefix', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The prefix to use for the output file names.', 'required': False, 'default_value': 'STAR', 'prefix': '--outputprefix', 'num_values': '0..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/star.aligner\\:v0.50', 'categories': 'RNA-seq', 'task_type': 'RNA-seq', 'author': 'Guy Bottu;V.I.B.-B.I.T.S.', 'command_line': 'perl /usr/local/bin/star_aligner_wrapper.pl --index --reads1 --alignendtoend --maxNmismatch --maxFmismatch --minoverhangannot --minoverhangnotannot --minintronlength --maxintronlength --matesmaxgap --multimapmismatchrange --maxmultimap --canonicaloverhang --noncanonicaloverhang --maponlyreportedjunctions --twopass --detectchimeric --outputunmapped --quantify --wiggle --wigglesignal --format --HIflag '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

# STAR.aligner urn:lsid:broad.mit.edu:cancer.software.genepattern.module.analysis:00370:2 #Tue Feb 10 19:12:06 UTC 2026 JVMLevel= LSID=urn\:lsid\:broad.mit.edu\:cancer.software.genepattern.module.analysis\:00370\:2 author=Guy Bottu;V.I.B.-B.I.T.S. categories=RNA-seq commandLine=perl /usr/local/bin/star_aligner_wrapper.pl --index --reads1 --alignendtoend --maxNmismatch --maxFmismatch --minoverhangannot --minoverhangnotannot --minintronlength --maxintronlength --matesmaxgap --multimapmismatchrange --maxmultimap --canonicaloverhang --noncanonicaloverhang --maponlyreportedjunctions --twopass --detectchimeric --outputunmapped --quantify --wiggle --wigglesignal --format --HIflag cpuType=any description=STAR (Spliced Transcripts Alignment to a Reference) 2.7.10b is a fast RNA-seq reads to genome mapper. It differs from other mappers as TopHat in that it gains speed at the expense of consuming more RAM and that it incorporates transcriptome annotation at the indexing build stage rather than at the analysis stage. It can optionally detect non-canonical splices and chimeric transcripts. fileFormat=bam;bg;sam;tab;wig job.docker.image=genepattern/star.aligner\:v0.50 language=C++ name=STAR.aligner os=any p10_MODE= p10_TYPE=Integer p10_default_value=21 p10_description=Minimum size of intron. A gap in the alignment between a read and the genome that is smaller is considered a deletion, not an intron. p10_fileFormat= p10_flag=--minintronlength p10_name=min.intron.length p10_numValues=1..1 p10_optional= p10_prefix= p10_prefix_when_specified= p10_range=1+ p10_type=java.lang.Integer p10_value= p11_MODE= p11_TYPE=Integer p11_default_value=500000 p11_description=Maximum size of intron. If a read aligns to the genome with a gap larger than this it is considered a chimeric read. The default value of 500,000 is fine-tuned to mammalian genomes, for plant and yeast genomes you will have to decrease it. p11_fileFormat= p11_flag=--maxintronlength p11_name=max.intron.length p11_numValues=1..1 p11_optional= p11_prefix= p11_prefix_when_specified= p11_range=1+ p11_type=java.lang.Integer p11_value= p12_MODE= p12_TYPE=Integer p12_default_value=500000 p12_description=Maximum distance between mate pair reads. If reads map to the genome farther apart the fragment is considered to be chimeric. The default value of 500,000 is fine-tuned to mammalian genomes, for plant and yeast genomes you will have to decrease it. p12_fileFormat= p12_flag=--matesmaxgap p12_name=mates.max.gap p12_numValues=1..1 p12_optional= p12_prefix= p12_prefix_when_specified= p12_range=1+ p12_type=java.lang.Integer p12_value= p13_MODE= p13_TYPE=Integer p13_default_value=0 p13_description=By default STAR only reports reads that map to multiple locations on the genome when they map with the highest possible score. You can ask STAR to report also secondary mappings with up to this much more mismatches than the primary mappings. p13_fileFormat= p13_flag=--multimapmismatchrange p13_name=secondary.mapping.mismatches.range p13_numValues=1..1 p13_optional= p13_prefix= p13_prefix_when_specified= p13_range=0+ p13_type=java.lang.Integer p13_value= p14_MODE= p14_TYPE=Integer p14_default_value=10 p14_description=Do not report reads that map to more than that many different locations on the genome. p14_fileFormat= p14_flag=--maxmultimap p14_name=max.multimapping p14_numValues=1..1 p14_optional= p14_prefix= p14_prefix_when_specified= p14_range=1+ p14_type=java.lang.Integer p14_value= p15_MODE= p15_TYPE=Integer p15_default_value=12 p15_description=Criterium for reporting de novo predicted splice junctions in the SJ.tab.out file \: for canonical splice sites at least one read with at least this overhang is needed. p15_fileFormat= p15_flag=--canonicaloverhang p15_name=min.report.canonical.junction.overhang p15_numValues=1..1 p15_optional= p15_prefix= p15_prefix_when_specified= p15_range=1+ p15_type=java.lang.Integer p15_value= p16_MODE= p16_TYPE=Integer p16_default_value=30 p16_description=Criterium for reporting de novo predicted splice junctions in the SJ.tab.out file \: for noncanonical splice sites at least 3 reads with at least this overhang are needed. p16_fileFormat= p16_flag=--noncanonicaloverhang p16_name=min.report.noncanonical.junction.overhang p16_numValues=1..1 p16_optional= p16_prefix= p16_prefix_when_specified= p16_range=1+ p16_type=java.lang.Integer p16_value= p17_MODE= p17_TYPE=TEXT p17_default_value=no p17_description=By default all mapped reads are output in the SAM/BAM file. Set this to yes if you want to bring the SAM/BAM file in agreement with the SJ.tab.out file, by outputting only reads that are not spliced or map to splice junctions that are annotated or have been de novo predicted. p17_fileFormat= p17_flag=--maponlyreportedjunctions p17_name=map.only.reported.juntions p17_numValues=1..1 p17_optional= p17_prefix= p17_prefix_when_specified= p17_type=java.lang.String p17_value=yes\=yes;no\=no p18_MODE= p18_TYPE=TEXT p18_default_value=no p18_description=Run STAR in 2-pass mode, that is, run STAR a first time, merge the found splice junctions with the splice junction annotation in the index, and run STAR a second time. Consult the documentation for more explanation. p18_fileFormat= p18_flag=--twopass p18_name=two.pass p18_numValues=1..1 p18_optional= p18_prefix= p18_prefix_when_specified= p18_type=java.lang.String p18_value=yes\=yes;no\=no p19_MODE= p19_TYPE=TEXT p19_default_value=no p19_description= p19_fileFormat= p19_flag=--detectchimeric p19_name=detect.chimeric.transcripts p19_numValues=1..1 p19_optional= p19_prefix= p19_prefix_when_specified= p19_type=java.lang.String p19_value=yes\=yes;no\=no p1_MODE=IN p1_TYPE=FILE p1_description=A STAR index. Select a prebuilt index from https\://datasets.genepattern.org/?prefix\=data/module_support_files/STAR/ or upload your own as a ZIP file (you can make one using STAR.indexer). p1_fileFormat=zip p1_flag=--index p1_name=star.index p1_numValues=1..1 p1_optional= p1_prefix= p1_prefix_when_specified= p1_type=java.io.File p1_value= p20_MODE= p20_TYPE=TEXT p20_default_value=no p20_description= p20_fileFormat= p20_flag=--outputunmapped p20_name=output.unmapped.reads p20_numValues=1..1 p20_optional= p20_prefix= p20_prefix_when_specified= p20_type=java.lang.String p20_value=yes\=yes;no\=no p21_MODE= p21_TYPE=TEXT p21_default_value=no p21_description=Write a table with number of reads mapped per gene and a supplementary BAM file with mappings to transcriptome instead of to genome coordinates. p21_fileFormat= p21_flag=--quantify p21_name=quantify.genes p21_numValues=1..1 p21_optional= p21_prefix= p21_prefix_when_specified= p21_type=java.lang.String p21_value=yes\=yes;no\=no p22_MODE= p22_TYPE=TEXT p22_default_value=None p22_description=Output a "wiggle" file for viewing in viewers like IGV or UCSC genome browser. p22_fileFormat= p22_flag=--wiggle p22_name=output.wiggle.file p22_numValues=1..1 p22_optional= p22_prefix= p22_prefix_when_specified= p22_type=java.lang.String p22_value=None\=none;bedGraph\=file in BedGraph format;wiggle\=file in WIG format p23_MODE= p23_TYPE=TEXT p23_default_value=all p23_description=From which bases to generate the signal for the "wiggle" file. By default they are all used, but you can choose to use only the bases at the 5'-end of the 1st read (useful for CAGE/RAMPAGE) or only from the 2nd mate from read pairs. p23_fileFormat= p23_flag=--wigglesignal p23_name=wiggle.signal p23_numValues=1..1 p23_optional= p23_prefix= p23_prefix_when_specified= p23_type=java.lang.String p23_value=all\=all;read1_5p\=only 5' from read 1;read2\=only from read 2 p24_MODE= p24_TYPE=TEXT p24_default_value=SAM p24_description= p24_fileFormat= p24_flag=--format p24_name=output.format p24_numValues=1..1 p24_optional= p24_prefix= p24_prefix_when_specified= p24_type=java.lang.String p24_value=SAM\=SAM unsorted;BAM Unsorted\=BAM unsorted ;BAM SortedByCoordinate\=BAM sorted by coordinate p25_MODE= p25_TYPE=TEXT p25_default_value=OneBestScore p25_description=Number of "hits" with higest score to label as "primary" in the SAM/BAM file. If you choose "only one" the others are labeled as "secondary" (all reads that map with lower than the highest score are labeled "secondary"). p25_fileFormat= p25_flag=--HIflag p25_name=HI.flag p25_numValues=1..1 p25_optional= p25_prefix= p25_prefix_when_specified= p25_type=java.lang.String p25_value=OneBestScore\=only one;AllBestScore\=all p26_MODE= p26_TYPE=TEXT p26_default_value=STAR p26_description=The prefix to use for the output file names. p26_fileFormat= p26_flag=--outputprefix p26_name=output.prefix p26_numValues=0..1 p26_optional=on p26_prefix=--outputprefix p26_prefix_when_specified=--outputprefix p26_type=java.lang.String p26_value= p2_MODE=IN p2_TYPE=FILE p2_default_value= p2_description=Unpaired reads or first mate for paired reads, as files in fastA or fastQ format. You can provide several files. p2_fileFormat=fa;fasta;fastq;fq p2_flag=--reads1 p2_name=reads.pair.1 p2_numValues=1+ p2_optional= p2_prefix= p2_prefix_when_specified= p2_type=java.io.File p2_value= p3_MODE=IN p3_TYPE=FILE p3_default_value= p3_description=Second mate for paired reads.

The files and the sequences inside the files must be in the same order as for the first mates. p3_fileFormat=fa;fasta;fastq;fq p3_flag=--reads2 p3_name=reads.pair.2 p3_numValues=0+ p3_optional=on p3_prefix=--reads2 p3_prefix_when_specified=--reads2 p3_type=java.io.File p3_value= p4_MODE= p4_TYPE=Integer p4_default_value= p4_description=Set this if you want to map only a selected set of reads at the top of the input (mainly useful for testing). p4_fileFormat= p4_flag=--mapN p4_name=max.reads.to.align p4_numValues=0..1 p4_optional=on p4_prefix=--mapN p4_prefix_when_specified=--mapN p4_range=1+ p4_type=java.lang.Integer p4_value= p5_MODE= p5_TYPE=TEXT p5_default_value=no p5_description=Align reads end to end and count all mistmatches. The default is to use instead "soft clipping" at both 5'- and 3'-end, that means to make a local alignment and ignore the contribution of the ends of the read to the final score if this improves the score. This can be useful for ChIP-seq and other DNA sequencing applications with reads that have already been quality-trimmed. p5_fileFormat= p5_flag=--alignendtoend p5_name=align.read.end.to.end p5_numValues=1..1 p5_optional= p5_prefix= p5_prefix_when_specified= p5_type=java.lang.String p5_value=yes\=yes;no\=no p6_MODE= p6_TYPE=Integer p6_default_value=10 p6_description=Maximum number of mismatches per read. Note that a mate pair is counted as one read. p6_fileFormat= p6_flag=--maxNmismatch p6_name=max.number.mismatches p6_numValues=1..1 p6_optional= p6_prefix= p6_prefix_when_specified= p6_range=0+ p6_type=java.lang.Integer p6_value= p7_MODE= p7_TYPE=Floating Point p7_default_value=0.3 p7_description=Maximum number of mismatches per read, expressed as the proportion between the number of mismatches and the mapped length of the read. Note that a mate pair is counted as one read. p7_fileFormat= p7_flag=--maxFmismatch p7_name=max.fraction.mistaches p7_numValues=1..1 p7_optional= p7_prefix= p7_prefix_when_specified= p7_range=0..1 p7_type=java.lang.Float p7_value= p8_MODE= p8_TYPE=Integer p8_default_value=3 p8_description=Minimum length that read must map at both sides of splice junction in order to accept mapping to a splice junction that is annotated in GTF of tab file. p8_fileFormat= p8_flag=--minoverhangannot p8_name=min.overhang.annotated.read p8_numValues=1..1 p8_optional= p8_prefix= p8_prefix_when_specified= p8_range=1+ p8_type=java.lang.Integer p8_value= p9_MODE= p9_TYPE=Integer p9_default_value=5 p9_description=Minimum length that read must map at both sides of splice junction in order to accept de novo discovery of splice junction. p9_fileFormat= p9_flag=--minoverhangnotannot p9_name=min.overhang.not.annotated.read p9_numValues=1..1 p9_optional= p9_prefix= p9_prefix_when_specified= p9_range=1+ p9_type=java.lang.Integer p9_value= privacy=public publicationDate=09/27/2023 15\:49 quality=production taskDoc=http\://software.broadinstitute.org/cancer/software/genepattern/modules/docs/STAR.aligner/1 taskType=RNA-seq userid=gbottu version=Adding support for gzipped input data

instruction: Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for STAR.indexer. Tool Information: - Name: STAR.indexer - Version: Rename index.dir parameter to output.file - Language: C++ - Description: The STAR indexer (version 2.7.10b) makes from a series of fastA files containing a genome an index for use with the STAR spliced read to genome aligner. It can optionally (but highly recommended \!) incorporate information about known intron-exon junctions. - Repository: Planning Data: {'module_name': 'STAR.indexer', 'parameters': [{'name': 'fasta.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'One or several fastA files containing the genome to index.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'fa;fasta', 'num_values': '1+'}, {'name': 'GTF.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A GTF file containing a list of gene model annotations. When provided, STAR will use it to improve the accuracy of the mapping of intron-exon splice junctions.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'gtf', 'prefix': '--GTFfile', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'tab.file', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A file in tab-separated format containing a list of gene model annotations, usually an SJ.tab.out file generated by a previous run of STAR.aligner. You can use it instead of or together with a GTF file. Consult the documentation for more explanation.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'tab', 'prefix': '--tabfile', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'output.file', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The name of the directory (and ZIP file) in which to put the STAR index.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'overhang', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'The length of the genomic sequence around the annotated intron-exon junctions. Ideally it should have a value max(ReadLength) - 1, but in most cases a generic value of 100 will work well.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '100', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'index.string.length', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Length of the strings used for making the index. For small genomes (less than 1 Gbase) it can be useful to scale it down to min(14, log2(GenomeLength)/2 - 1).', 'required': True, 'default_value': '14', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'bin.size', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Size of the bins for storage. If the genome contains a large number of separate scaffolds ("references") instead of just the full chromosomes and maybe a few scaffolds you can reduce RAM consumption by setting this to min(18, log2(GenomeLength/NumberOfReferences)).', 'required': True, 'default_value': '18', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'RAM.limit', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Upper limit for RAM allocated to indexing process, in Gbyte. For very large genomes you might heve to increase this, but make sure that the RAM is indeed physically present on the server and you have permission to make it available for the process.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '31', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/star.indexer\\:v0.48', 'categories': 'RNA-seq', 'task_type': 'RNA-seq', 'author': 'Guy Bottu;V.I.B.-B.I.T.S.', 'command_line': 'perl /usr/local/bin/star_indexer_wrapper.pl --fastafilelist --indexdir --overhang --indexstringlength --binsize --RAM '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

It can optionally (but highly recommended \!) incorporate information about known intron-exon junctions. fileFormat=zip job.docker.image=genepattern/star.indexer\:v0.48 language=C++ name=STAR.indexer os=any p1_MODE=IN p1_TYPE=FILE p1_default_value= p1_description=One or several fastA files containing the genome to index. p1_fileFormat=fa;fasta p1_flag=--fastafilelist p1_name=fasta.file p1_numValues=1+ p1_optional= p1_prefix= p1_prefix_when_specified= p1_type=java.io.File p1_value= p2_MODE=IN p2_TYPE=FILE p2_default_value= p2_description=A GTF file containing a list of gene model annotations. When provided, STAR will use it to improve the accuracy of the mapping of intron-exon splice junctions. p2_fileFormat=gtf p2_flag=--GTFfile p2_name=GTF.file p2_numValues=0..1 p2_optional=on p2_prefix=--GTFfile p2_prefix_when_specified=--GTFfile p2_type=java.io.File p2_value= p3_MODE=IN p3_TYPE=FILE p3_default_value= p3_description=A file in tab-separated format containing a list of gene model annotations, usually an SJ.tab.out file generated by a previous run of STAR.aligner. You can use it instead of or together with a GTF file. Consult the documentation for more explanation. p3_fileFormat=tab p3_flag=--tabfile p3_name=tab.file p3_numValues=0..1 p3_optional=on p3_prefix=--tabfile p3_prefix_when_specified=--tabfile p3_type=java.io.File p3_value= p4_MODE= p4_TYPE=TEXT p4_default_value= p4_description=The name of the directory (and ZIP file) in which to put the STAR index. p4_fileFormat= p4_flag=--indexdir p4_name=output.file p4_numValues=0..1 p4_optional= p4_prefix= p4_prefix_when_specified= p4_type=java.lang.String p4_value= p5_MODE= p5_TYPE=Integer p5_default_value=100 p5_description=The length of the genomic sequence around the annotated intron-exon junctions. Ideally it should have a value max(ReadLength) - 1, but in most cases a generic value of 100 will work well. p5_fileFormat= p5_flag=--overhang p5_name=overhang p5_numValues=1..1 p5_optional= p5_prefix= p5_prefix_when_specified= p5_range=1+ p5_type=java.lang.Integer p5_value= p6_MODE= p6_TYPE=Integer p6_default_value=14 p6_description=Length of the strings used for making the index. For small genomes (less than 1 Gbase) it can be useful to scale it down to min(14, log2(GenomeLength)/2 - 1). p6_fileFormat= p6_flag=--indexstringlength p6_name=index.string.length p6_numValues=1..1 p6_optional= p6_prefix= p6_prefix_when_specified= p6_range=1+ p6_type=java.lang.Integer p6_value= p7_MODE= p7_TYPE=Integer p7_default_value=18 p7_description=Size of the bins for storage. If the genome contains a large number of separate scaffolds ("references") instead of just the full chromosomes and maybe a few scaffolds you can reduce RAM consumption by setting this to min(18, log2(GenomeLength/NumberOfReferences)). p7_fileFormat= p7_flag=--binsize p7_name=bin.size p7_numValues=1..1 p7_optional= p7_prefix= p7_prefix_when_specified= p7_range=1+ p7_type=java.lang.Integer p7_value= p8_MODE= p8_TYPE=Integer p8_default_value=31 p8_description=Upper limit for RAM allocated to indexing process, in Gbyte. For very large genomes you might heve to increase this, but make sure that the RAM is indeed physically present on the server and you have permission to make it available for the process. p8_fileFormat= p8_flag=--RAM p8_name=RAM.limit p8_numValues=1..1 p8_optional= p8_prefix= p8_prefix_when_specified= p8_range=1+ p8_type=java.lang.Integer p8_value= privacy=public publicationDate=02/08/2023 14\:58 quality=production taskDoc=http\://software.broadinstitute.org/cancer/software/genepattern/modules/docs/STAR.indexer/1 taskType=RNA-seq userid=guy.bottu@vib.be version=Rename index.dir parameter to output.file

instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for PreprocessVelocityTranscriptome. Tool Information: - Name: PreprocessVelocityTranscriptome - Version: initial release - Language: any - Description: Extract transcript and intron sequences from the genome sequence using the eisaR package in order to quantify both intronic (unprocessed) and exonic (processed) RNA abundances in each cell with alevin.
A necessary preprocessing step to enable RNA velocity analysis. - Repository: https\://github.com/genepattern/PreprocessVelocityTranscriptome/tree/v1 Planning Data: {'module_name': 'PreprocessVelocityTranscriptome', 'parameters': [{'name': 'GTF', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A GTF file containing the genomic ranges to extract features from for quantification.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.gtf.gz;gtf;gtf.gz', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Genome.FASTA', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': "A FASTA file of the genomic sequence corresponding to the organism's GTF file.", 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.fa.gz;fa;fa.gz;FASTA;fasta;fasta.gz', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Insert.Size', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Insert size/RNA read length.
For standard 10x Chromium Single Cell 3\' v3/v3.1 chemistry the insert size is "91", for 10x Chromium Single Cell 3\' v2 the insert size is "98" for dual indexed 10x Chromium kits containing an i5 index, the insert size is "90". This value is used to determine valid alignment positions across exon-intron junctions.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Intron.Flank.Trim', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Adjusts the Insert.Size value so that reads that align to an exon-intron junction must have at least Intron.Flank.Trim base pair alignment to the intron in order to be quantified as an intronic alignment. Typically 1-5 basepairs.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '5', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Intron.Extraction', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Consider transcripts separately ("separate") when extracting intronic regions, or collapsed to gene level ("collapse").', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'separate', 'choices': 'separate\\=separate;collapse\\=collapse', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'Join.Overlapping.Introns', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Some transcripts/genes may have intronic sequences that overlap. These overlapping sequences can be combined into a single record for quantification or be kept separate.', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'TRUE', 'choices': 'TRUE\\=True;FALSE\\=False', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/prepvelocitytxome\\:v1', 'categories': 'preprocess & utilities;single-cell;singlecell', 'task_type': 'preprocess & utilities', 'author': 'Anthony S. Castanza;UCSD-MesirovLab', 'command_line': 'Rscript /module/txome.for.velocity.R --gtf --genome --length --trim --type --join '} Generate a complete, valid manifest file in key=value format.

This value is used to determine valid alignment positions across exon-intron junctions. p3_fileFormat= p3_flag=--length p3_name=Insert.Size p3_numValues=1..1 p3_optional= p3_prefix= p3_prefix_when_specified= p3_range=1+ p3_type=java.lang.Integer p3_value= p4_MODE= p4_TYPE=Integer p4_default_value=5 p4_description=Adjusts the Insert.Size value so that reads that align to an exon-intron junction must have at least Intron.Flank.Trim base pair alignment to the intron in order to be quantified as an intronic alignment. instruction:
Generate a complete GenePattern module manifest for BWA.aln.

Tool Information:
- Name: BWA.aln
- Version: Updated BWA.Index drop down menu to new BWA module support files location at datasets.genepattern.org (Amazon S3). and specify docker image, to production
- Language: any
- Description: A fast and accurate short-read alignment tool that allows for mismatches and gaps. Alignments are output in a SAM format file, which provides Phred-scale quality scores for each alignment.  Uses BWA 0.7.4 aln and samse/sampe.
- Repository: 

Planning Data:
{'module_name': 'BWA.aln', 'parameters': [{'name': 'BWA.index', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'A zip file or directory containing BWA index files.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': '.zip;DIRECTORY', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'reads.pair.1', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'Single-end or first paired-end reads file in FASTA, FASTQ, or BAM format.  For paired-end data, this should be the forward ("*_1" or "left") input file.  Note\\: the FASTA or FASTQ can be gzipped.', 'required': True, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'bam;fa;fa.gz;fasta;fasta.gz;fastq;fastq.gz;fn;fq;fq.gz', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'reads.pair.2', 'type': 'FILE', 'description': 'The reverse ("*_2" or "right") input file for paired-end reads in FASTA, FASTQ, or BAM format. Note\\: the FASTA or FASTQ can be gzipped.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'file_format': 'fa;fa.gz;fasta;fasta.gz;fastq;fastq.gz;fn;fq;fq.gz', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'bam.mapping', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Specifies how to map BAM input. This is only required if input file is in BAM format.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'choices': '\\=Not set...;single;first;second;paired', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.edit.distance', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The max edit distance. This specifies a threshold of the maximum number of deletions, insertions, and substitutions needed to transform the reference sequence into the read sequence.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.num.gap', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum number of gap opens. This specifies a threshold of the maximum number of gaps that can be initiated to match a given read to the reference.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.gap.extension', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum number of gap extensions. This specifies a threshold of the maximum number of bases by which gaps in a read can be extended.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'prefix': '-e\\=', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.deletion.length', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': "Disallow a long deletion within this many bp of the 3' end.", 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.indel.length', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Disallow an indel within this many bp of the ends', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'seed.length', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'The set of bases determined by this option in the high-quality (left) end of the read is the seed.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.seed.edit.distance', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum edit distance in the seed; that is, the maximum number of changes required to transform the reference sequence of the seed into the read sequence of the seed.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'mismatch.penalty', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Mismatch penalty', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'gap.open.penalty', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Gap open penalty.  The gap open penalty is the score taken away for the initiation of the gap in sequence. To make the match more significant you can try to make the gap penalty larger.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'gap.extension.penalty', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Gap extension penalty.  The gap extension penalty is added to the standard gap penalty for each base or residue in the gap.  To reduce long gaps, increase the extension gap penalty.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.best.hits', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Proceed with suboptimal alignments if there are no more than this many equally best hits. This option only affects paired-end mapping.', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'iterative.search', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Whether to disable iterative search', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'no', 'choices': 'yes;no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'trim.reads', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Specifies a quality threshold for read trimming', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'Illumina.1.3.format', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'The input is in the Illumina 1.3+ read format', 'required': True, 'default_value': 'no', 'choices': 'yes;no', 'num_values': '1..1'}, {'name': 'barcode.length', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': "Length of barcode starting from the 5' end", 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.insert.size', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Specifies the maximum insert size for a read pair to be considered to be mapped properly', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.occurrences', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Specifies the maximum occurrences of a read for pairing', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.alignments', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum number of alignments to output in the XA tag for reads paired properly', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'max.dc.alignments', 'type': 'Integer', 'description': 'Maximum number of alignments to output in the XA tag for disconcordant read pairs (excluding singletons)', 'required': False, 'default_value': '', 'num_values': '0..1'}, {'name': 'output.prefix', 'type': 'TEXT', 'description': 'Prefix to use for output file name', 'required': True, 'default_value': '<reads.pair.1_basename>', 'num_values': '1..1'}], 'docker_image_tag': 'genepattern/bwa_modules\\:v0.2', 'categories': 'rna-seq', 'task_type': 'rna-seq', 'author': 'Heng Li, Broad Institute', 'command_line': 'perl /opt/genepatt/BWA.aln/src/bwa_aln_wrapper.pl -bwa <BWA_0.7.4>/bwa -libdir <libdir> -w1 <BWA.index> -p1 <reads.pair.1> -p2 <reads.pair.2> -bm <bam.mapping> -n1 <max.edit.distance> -g <max.num.gap> <max.gap.extension> -d <max.deletion.length> -idl <max.indel.length> -l <seed.length> -k <max.seed.edit.distance> -m <mismatch.penalty>  -o1 <gap.open.penalty> -E <gap.extension.penalty> -r <max.best.hits> -n2 <iterative.search> -q <trim.reads> -ilmn <Illumina.1.3.format> -B <barcode.length> -a <max.insert.size> -u <max.occurrences> -x1
